loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 25 years old, married to David and has one child aged five. She owns a retail shop that has been in operation for one year and earns her a monthly profit of 10,000 KES.
Millicent has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner, KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock for the shop such as sugar, milk, cooking oil, tea leaves etc.
With her anticipated profit Millicent plans to expand her business since it is small. In the near future she hopes to grow her business and increase her stock to half a million.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the shop like sugar, milk, cooking oil, tea leaves etc

loans.name: Willyn

texts.en:
Willyn, whose picture appears above, is 32 years old. She is married and is taking good care of her three school-aged children. She works for a living in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Willyn noticed the booming demand for Avon products in this place. This, then, gave her the idea of becoming an Avon dealer, which she started five years ago. She earns a total of 3,000 PHP per month from this buying and selling business activity. Willyn enjoys this kind of job – moreover it enhances and develops her selling skills.
Willyn joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, earlier this year. Her loan application for 4,000 PHP has been approved. With this amount, Willyn can now order additional Avon products to sell in her neighborhood and in neighboring communities. She hopes to have more revenue so she can start ordering larger numbers of the most demanded items.

loans.use: to order additional Avon products.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong was born in 1968. She lives in Xom Vang village with her husband and two children. Her husband is a worker. He has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). Mrs. Phuong works in Thang Long industrial. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to have more income and so she wants raise pigs. Since 2006, she has joined in SEDA. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy pigs and food for them.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
The man whose picture appears above is Oscar. He is 51 years old. Married as he is, Oscar finds of ways of supporting the family's means of survival especially the future for his two grown children. He is settled in Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past 10 years, he engaged in service-based work. From it, he was able to generate PHP 7,000 a month.

Joining GDMPC was Oscar's long-time plan: to have easy access to financial services. He became a certified GDMPC member earlier this year. A loan of PHP 20,000 was applied for by him to purchase motorcycle accessories for better service quality. Good service brings in good flows of income. The revenue to gain is allotted for his children' studies and other will be for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle accessories for better service quality.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 years old and married to Martin. They are blessed with three children, ages 18, 15 and 12. She has been in the farming business for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family needs.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand by purchasing another farm. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy farming which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Wassman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 24 years old, single and lives with two family members who work.

Wassman has been a tailor since 2005; she makes and repairs women’s and men’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good experience and she is well known in her area.


She decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine, a generator and to renovate her workshop. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine, a generator and to renovate her workshop.

loans.name: Siguitemasson I Group

texts.fr:
SIGUITEMASSON I est un regroupement de dix  femmes qui sont  mariées, ont moyenne 40 ans, en moyenne 6 enfants et qui vivent   dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont essentiellement le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, ALIMATA la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000F CFA environs par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASSON I envisagent avec cette collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso renforcer leurs capacités financières  et ainsi  garantir leur productivité.
texts.en:
SIGUITEMASSON I is a group made up of 10 married women with an average age of 40 and and average of 6 children and they live in traditional extended families in Koula, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.
They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to be able to better organize their activities during the start of the wintering. With this loan, which is their first, Alimata, the first woman on the right in the row of seated people. plans on buying agricultural inputs and small farming equipment, and paying the labor and weeding costs to maintain approximately half a hectare of rice and peanuts.
The harvested crops are sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco, and N'Golobougou to a customer base made up of both men and women. They plan on making an average profit of approximately 40,000 CFA per cycle. The members of the SIGUITEMASSON I group hope their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso will bolster their financial means and ensure their productivity.

loans.use: to pay for labor, agricultural inputs, and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Tha was born in 1960. She lives with her husband and two children. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice but also, she raises pigs and sells vegetables in the market. Her family has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2006, she has joined in SEDA and always repaid loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add plates, cups and jugs to his business.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 52 years old. She is from the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Carlita is married with five grown children. She started raising pigs 10 years ago to make a living. Evidently, Carlita really has the passion for raising domestic animals like pigs. From this work, she earns 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.
 
In 2008, Carlita joined GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. For the third time, she has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase food to nourish the pigs she raises. Carlita hopes to make enough money from selling the animals that she can start working on house repair.

loans.use: to purchase food to nourish the pigs she raises

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has two children.

Imad has been an owner of a workshop since 2003. He makes tombs. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1000 loan to purchase a stone cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a stone cleaning machine.

loans.name: Lowrenmie

texts.en:
Lowrenmie is 27 years old. She is married with one small child. She works for a living in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been a "hypo" retailer for three years. "Hypo" is a liquid substance used in laundry to get rid of dirt/stains and is a very good stain remover. Retailing this substance gives Lowrenmie a monthly income of 1,000 PHP.
Earlier this year, Lowrenmie joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to have easy access to financial services. This is her first loan application for a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. The money is intended to acquire enough supply of "hypo" to sell. She hopes that increasing demand for the product will give her a high return on her investment.

loans.use: to acquire enough supply of "hypo" (a stain remover) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and watering pipes.

loans.name: Siguitemasson Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe SIGUITEMASSON II sont des femmes mariées avec en moyenne 37 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MINATA la deuxième assise à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage  pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASSON II comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  60 000FCFA environs par campagne
texts.en:
The 10 members of the SIGUITEMASSON II group are married women with an average age of 37 and an average of 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Koula, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the 2nd administrative region of Mali.
They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to be able to better organize their activities in the beginning of the wintering. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. This is their first loan with the institution.
With this loan, Minata, the second seated from the left, plans on buying agricultural inputs and small farming equipment, and paying for labor and weeding to maintain approximately half a hectare of peanuts. 
The harvested crops are sold at markets in Baou, Koula, Banco, and N'Golobougou to a customer base made up of both men and women. The women plan on making an average profit of 60,000 FCFA per cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 63 years old, married and has two children. One of them works.

Ali has been an owner of a bakery since 1996; he makes all kinds of bread and pastries. He has a long experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to fix the floor of his bakery and to purchase a mixer. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to fix the floor of his bakery and to purchase a mixer.

loans.name: Mechel

texts.en:
Mechel is 17 years old. She is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a single lady who has engaged in business at a very young age. Mechel has been vending food items for 2 years. It is her own simple way of making a living and somehow, support her studies. A monthly earning of 2,500 PHP from this activity is quite enough to provide her school needs. 

Mechel joined GDMPC earlier this year. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase food items to vend, like ripe bananas. Mechel hopes to own a food stall in the town market in the future and finish a business course in a reputable university.

loans.use: to purchase food items to vend, like ripe bananas

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 36 years old and married to Maureen. They have two school-going children. Philip has a retail shop. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy salad, sugar, cooking flour, bread and milk.

He hopes to see his business grow and own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy salad, sugar, cooking flour, bread and milk

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 grown children. To make a living, she owns and operates a retail store at home. Isabelita has been operating the business for one year already. In that short time of operation, she usually earns 2,000 PHP a month. 

Isabelita is one of GDMPC's members joining this year. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase several grocery items to sell, such as soft drinks, salable liquor items and more. Isabelita hopes to lay aside part of her earnings for store improvement and business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase several grocery items to sell, such as soft drinks, liquor items and more

loans.name: Fakhri

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has three children.

Fakhri has been an owner of a store since 2008, selling hunting tools and equipment. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is  well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a 26-year-old married woman. She is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines and has 2 young kids to attend to. Fishing is her prime source of living since the family is strategically situated nearby the sea. It was 10 years ago when she began doing this job. She typically generated a monthly revenue of 5,000 PHP.

Earlier this year, Ellen applied for her first loan transaction with GDMPC worth 5,000 PHP. The money will be used to purchase materials needed to repair her fishing boat. Ellen hopes to have a fish vending stall in a town market to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Siguitemasson Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe SIGUITEMASSON III sont de femmes mariées  qui ont en moyenne 30 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, SANATA la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASSON III comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the SIGUITEMASSON III group are married women with an average age of 30 and an average of 5 children, and they live in polygamous families in Koula, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the 2nd administrative region of Mali.
They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to be able to better organize their activities in the beginning of overwintering. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with the institution.
With this loan, Sanata, the woman in the middle of the seated row, hopes to buy agricultural inputs and small farming equipment, and pay for labor and weeding to maintain approximately half a hectare of rice and peanuts
The harvested crops are sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco, and N'Golobougou to a customer base made up of both men and women. The women in the SIGUITEMASSON III group hope to make an average profit of 30,000 FCFA per cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is 51 years old. He is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with 5 grown children. He lives near the sea. Most of the residents' means of livelihood is fishing and Dionesio is one of them. He has been doing this for one year now. He normally receives a monthly income of 3,000 PHP from fishing.

Earlier this year, Dionesio applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase new fishing net for his livelihood. This serves as his first loan taken out from the cooperative. With the new fishing stuff, Dionesio hopes for a good catch and to deal them at reasonable prices. He plans to improve his fishing boat using the possible revenue that he might be receiving from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing net

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 34 years old and married to Faith. They are blessed with two children aged seven and three years. He has been in dairy farming for three years with a monthly income of 12,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to purchase animal feeds and build a shed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy a water harvest tank. His hopes are to advance in his farming business and educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and build a shed

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has three children.

Bassem has been the owner of a workshop for blacksmithing and welding since 2001. He has a good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy a small truck and repair tools. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy a small truck and repair tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water pump and seedlings

loans.name: Siguitemasson Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix 10 femmes qui constituent le groupe SIGUITEMASSON IV sont toutes mariées avec en moyenne 33 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont essentiellement le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MARIAM, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 women who make up the SIGUITEMASSON IV group are all married with an average age of 33 and on average three children, and they live in polygamous families in Koula, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They are working together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are essentially rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, MARIAM, second from the left, standing, intends to buy farm inputs and small agricultural material and pay plowing costs to maintain about 0.25 hectares of peanuts. 

The produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of 25,000 F CFA per growing season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small agricultural material.

loans.name: Mary Mae

texts.en:
Mary Mae is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is only 19 years old and married. She has one child to attend to now. At a very young age, Mary Mae had proven her capability in handling a business. She cultivates fruit trees and harvests mango for sale. It was five years ago when she started dealing in this. She makes a monthly income of approximately 3,000 PHP.

Mary Mae has been a GDMPC member since 2010. For the second time around, Mary Mae is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from the cooperative. This will be used to purchase fruit seeds/seedlings to grow and trade soon. She hopes for a big hit on the market on the next cycle of trading and a gradual expansion of her business size.

loans.use: to purchase fruit seeds/seedlings to grow and trade

loans.name: Kaiss

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has one child.

Kaiss has been an owner of a shop for home appliances since 2007. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to make shelves for his shop and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make shelves for his shop and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Jamilya's Group

texts.en:
Jamilya is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married to an electrician. Together with her husband she brings up two sons and two daughters. The sons study at school and the daughters are not in school yet as they are preschool age (under seven). At the moment Jamilya is on maternity leave. She looks after her daughters. In order to earn additional money to meet the family's needs, Jamilya and her husband breed livestock. They started this activity eight years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 soms. Reselling livestock at a higher price after fattening, they earn an additional 2,000 soms per month. Jamilya has applied for this loan because she needs additional money to purchase a washing machine in order to improve their living conditions. In the future she wishes to purchase a vehicle for the family. Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old and married to David. They are blessed with two children, aged 25 and 18 years. She has been selling spare parts for the past five years with a monthly income of 11,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD. She  will use the loan to add stock of spare parts to her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her business. Her hopes are to open many branches in different sites, which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To add stock of spare parts to her business.

loans.name: Siguitemasson V Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUITEMASSON V est constitué de  six femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KARIA première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. KARIA compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The SIGUITEMASSON V group is made up of six married women with an average age of 33 and on average five children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Koula, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They are working together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, KARIA, first on the right, standing, intends to buy farm inputs and small agricultural material and pay plowing costs to maintain about 0.75 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. KARIA expects to make an profit of 60,000 F CFA more or less at the end of the growing season.
.
.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small agricultural material.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Sixty-two-year-old Mary is engaged in farming. She owns and tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. Mary primarily grows rice crops to sell. Mary also raises pigs in her backyard. She sells her pigs at the market. Mary earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her business. 

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en:
Enoch, 35, is self-reliant and hardworking. He is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. Since 2006, he has been running a retail shop to make ends meet for his family. He makes extra income from the salary he gets from working as a a security officer. 

He wants in the next five years to have accumulated enough income so as to educate his children. His dream is to acquire a piece of land and build rental houses. 

He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and sodas. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for the financial management training.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and sodas.

loans.name: Byambahuu

texts.en:
Byambahuu is 55 years old and lives with her husband and her daughter who studies at the Technology University, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her two oldest children live separately. Byambahuu's family live in a Mongolian ger or yurt.  
Byambahuu has been in the bag retail business since 1995 and she sells bags in Narantuul trade market. From 2000, she successfully persuaded her brothers and sisters to join the bag retail business. Byambahuu's business' total capital turnover is five million MNT. She is very experienced in her field and has stable business activity. Byambahuu is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more bags from China and increase her working capital. She says she would like to remodel her fence and yard.

loans.use: to purchase more bags from China.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old. She is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is now separated from her husband and is so blessed to have 13 adult children -- quite a big family. She has been engaged in this motor transport activity for three years already, not to mention the other means of livelihood. From this work alone, she earns a total of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.
 
The year 2010 is when she joined GDMPC. This time, Virginia is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 from the cooperative. This is borrowed to purchase motor accessories and stuffs needed to expand service seating capacity. The more seats that are available, the more income to earn. Day by day, Virginia hopes to improve the general living conditions of the family and to have an escalating flow of earnings as she go along the way.

loans.use: To purchase motor accessories and stuffs needed to expand seating capacity on her motor transport.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, single and lives with five family members. One of them works.

Akram has been an owner of a shop selling shoes for women, men and kids since 2005. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.
 
He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate and repair his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to make more shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and repair his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to make more shelves.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and married to Faith. They are blessed with two children. He has been a bus driver for the past seven years with the monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET. He will use the loan to service the vehicle and renew the p.s.v. insurance cover. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy another bus. His hopes are to educate his children and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To service the vehicle and renew the p.s.v. insurance cover.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is from the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 50 years old, married and has 2 grown children. She owns and operates a retail store at home to make a living. She has been doing this for 11  years. Cecilia usually makes a monthly income of PHP 10,000.00 from the store operations. 
Earlier this year, Cecilia joined GDMPC to have an easy access to financial services. She has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000.00 from the organization to purchase grocery items or daily use commodities to sell in the store. She hopes to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items or daily use commodities to sell.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 60 years old,  married woman with 3 children. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family.

Monina and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Monina also raises pigs in their backyard. She works hard to help provide for the needs 0f the family and send to send their kids to school.

Monina has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes to be able to sustain her childrens' education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is from the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is 42 years old, married with 2 grown children. She owns and operates a retail store to make a living. The business is now five years old. Every month, Elvie gets a total of PHP 3,000.00 from the store operations. 
In 2006, she became a GDMPC member. This time, Elvie is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from the cooperative to purchase grocery items to sell in the store. Elvie hopes to sustain her livelihood and expand the selling area for more cash inflows.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiri I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe TIESSIRI I sont de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MOUSSODJE, la première personne debout à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group TIESSIRI I are married women who average 39 years of age  and six children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. 

The group members are now on their first collaboration with the institution. With this loan, MOUSSODJE, who is the first one standing at the left in the photo, intends to buy inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay the cost of plowing for maintaining about 0.75 hectare of rice and peanuts. After the harvests, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. The group members make an average profit of about 45,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, and assorted supplies and equipment

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 29 year old a single mother of two children, ages twelve and  ten. She has been running a butchery for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her children’s needs.

Beatrice is applying for her first loan from KADET  LTD,after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy goats and  a cow for her stock.

With the anticipated profit from the business Beatrice hopes to open a green grocer. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children, buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy goats and a cow for her stock

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 24 years old, married and has three children.

Hanaa has been a tailor since 2009. She makes and repairs women’s and men’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of the local consumer, good experience and is well known in her area.

She decided to apply for a $2400 loan to purchase a tailoring machine and to add more inventories such as tissues and sewing supplies. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine, tissues and sewing supplies

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two grown children. Operating a retail store is the family's source of living. That was 20 years ago when she began handling the business. Arlene normally makes a monthly income of PHP 10,000.00  from the store operations.
Earlier this year, Arlene joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan worth PHP 15,000.00 from the organization. The money will be used to purchase grocery or daily use commodities to sell. Arlene hopes to extend the managed business area and offer more of swine foods which highly indicates its growing demands of the place.

loans.use: To purchase grocery or daily use commodities to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiri Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe TIESSIRI II est constitué de  10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, YAMA TAHIROU, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. YAMA TAHIROU compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The group TIESSIRI II is composed of ten married women who average 34 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are rice and peanuts.

The group members are now on their first collaboration with the institution. With this initial loan, YAMA TAHIROU, who is the second person sitting from the left in the photo, intends to buy inputs and assorted equipment and to pay the cost of plowing and weeding for maintaining about 0.5 hectare of peanuts. After the harvest, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. YAMA TAHIROU plans on making an average profit of about 60,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, weeding, and assorted equipment

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag is 44 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a Mongolian ger (or yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. Her daughter is 23 years old and studies at the university. Tungalag operates a used clothing trading business. She started her business in 2004 and gathered tremendous experience in her field. She manages her business on her own and purchases her goods from the wholesale store. She has a stabilized business and is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says, "I want to improve my life and expand my house." She is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more used clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 56 years old and a single mother of three children. 

Margaret is a fishmonger and has been running the business for the past 10 years. She is applying for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy more fish to sell. 

The anticipated profits will be used to cater for the family's needs.

She hopes to become a distribution site for fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish to add to her stock.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is 57 years old and a widower. He has three children. Orlando is a farmer who tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice and corn crops to sell. Orlando works hard to improve his business and support his children. 

He applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Orlando hopes to own and manage a bigger farm area in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosabilita

texts.en:
Rosabilita is from Clarin, Misamis Ocidental, Philippines. She is 48 years old, married and has three grown children. Rosabilita grows corn to make a living and commenced this activity three years ago. She normally earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

Rosabilita is one of the recently registered members of GDMPC. She has applied a loan of PHP 10,000 from the organization to purchase corn fertilizers for fast growth and producing high-quality corn products. The expected revenue is intended for agricultural expansion to gain more than the regular income received.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizers for fast growth and producing high-quality corn products.

loans.name: Gulsaara's Group

texts.en: Gulsaara is the leader of this group. She is 39 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She brings up two daughters, both of whom study at school. In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Gulsaara breeds cattle. She also sews Kyrgyz national cloth, blankets and pillows. In this way, she earns 10,000 soms per month. Gulsaara applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing fabrics and materials, which are needed for sewing. In the future, she wishes to build a new house for her daughters. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has six children.

Kareem has been an owner of a store since 2009, selling women and kids clothing, cosmetics and tissues. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan to enlarge his store and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To enlarge his store and add more inventories.

loans.name: Vu's Group

texts.en:
Vu was born in 1980. She is married with two children who are going to school. Her husband is a worker. Mrs Vu grows rice, sells vegetables and raises pigs. She has had these jobs for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last loan cycle, she borrowed 6.322.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.066.000 VND to buy food for the pigs. She is the leader of a five-member group loan.

 About the other borrowers in her group:

 Xuan is 49 years old. She is a farmer. She would like to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy food for the pigs.

 Toan is 58 years old. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to invest in her livestock.

 Chu is 51 years old. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to buy 100 chickens.

 Ha is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy food for the ducks.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 59 years old and is married to Esther; the couple is blessed with children who are all adults. He has been running a retail shop for three years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

Peter is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase sugar, wheat flour, rice, and maize meal for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Peter hopes to expand his retail shop. He hopes and dreams to open a wholesale shop, which will help him improve his and his wife's standard of living since their children are adults.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, rice, and maize meal for his shop

loans.name: Komlan Cyrille

texts.fr:
Cyrille  est un jeune de 26ans. Il est marié à une tresseuse .Il n’est pas encore parent.
Cyrille travaille depuis 2009 comme gérant d’un débit de boissons. Il achète à Lomé et gère seul l’activité.
Cyrille à requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Cyrille  is a 26-year-old young man. He is married to a hair stylist. He is not yet a parent.
Cyrille has managed a small bar since 2009. He purchases his stocks in Lome and manages the business himself.
Cyrille is requesting this loan for the first time from WAGES in order to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 48 years old and is a married man with a 7-year-old child. He is a farmer who tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato, Philippines. Oscar grows rice and pineapples. He sells his harvest at his town's market.

Oscar is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow and provide a better income for his family. He also hopes to save for his child's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tiessiri V Group

texts.fr:
TIESSIRI V  est un regroupement de 10 de femmes toute  mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MINATA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 15 000F CFA environs par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI V ambitionnent renforcer leurs capacités financières  d’où leurs productivités dans leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
TIESSIRI V is a group composed of ten married women who average 29 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. The group members are now on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this initial loan, MINATA, who is the first person sitting from the left in the photo, intends to buy inputs and assorted equipment and to pay the cost of plowing and weeding for maintaining about 0.25 hectare of peanuts. After the harvest, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. 

The group members plan on making an average profit of about 15,000 francs CFA per planting. They have the ambition of bolstering their financial capacity and thus their productivity through their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, and assorted equipment

loans.name: Dunchinsuren

texts.en:
Dunchinsuren is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His three children are university students.  He has been in the public transportation sector since 2000 and now does transport between the Tsaij and Narantuul markets. His wife works with him as a conductor.

Dunchinsuren's business activity is stable, and his daily income is 80,000 MNT. Dunchinsuren is an open-minded and hardworking person who would like to build his own house. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Makki

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children.

Makki has been an owner of a store since 2008, selling women and kid's clothing, cosmetics and tissues. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to purchase additional inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to purchase additional inventories.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 31 years old and is married to Samuel. The couple is blessed with two children. Margaret has been running a hotel for the past three years with a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family's needs.

Margaret is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the group by an existing KADET client. She will use the loan to buy cooking fat, sugar, tables, and chairs.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes are to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Zeveg

texts.en:
Zeveg is 52 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. In 2005, Zeveg and her husband, who are both retired, opened a grocery store in their home. Zeveg purchases her products and goods from the Narantuul market. Her total working capital is 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT), and her daily income is about 60,000 MNT. She used some of her working capital to remodel her grocery store.

Zeveg is a hardworking person and is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to increase her working capital and purchase more products for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Tiessiri Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe TIESSIRI VI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et qui ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont  le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAMA, debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz .
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group TIESSIRI VI are married women who average 29 years of age  and three children each. The women live in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. The group members are now on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, MAMA, who is standing in the middle of the photo, intends to buy inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay the cost of plowing for maintaining about 0.25 hectare of rice. After the harvests, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. MAMA plans on making an average profit of about 20,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, weeding, and assorted equipment

loans.name: Luke

texts.en: Luke is a thirty-six-year-old married man with five children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has a retail shop, hardware shop and bar business which he has operated for six years. His hardships are debtors, price fluctuations and high transport costs, and his vision is a large scale retail shop plus an educated family. Luke intends to use the credit facility to buy iron sheets, sugar and clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets, sugar and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tiessiri Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe TIESSIRI VII sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées par le groupe sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FANTA  première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 65.000F CFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The five members of the group TIESSIRI VII are all married women who average 25 years of age  and three children each. The women live in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. The group members are now on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, FANTA, who is  the first person standing from the right in the photo, intends to buy inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay the cost of plowing and weeding for maintaining about 0.75 hectare of rice and peanuts. After the harvests, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. FANTA plans on making a profit of about 65,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, manure, herbicides,weeding, and assorted equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, mangoes and oranges to add to her stock.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a thirty-nine-year-old single mother of four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Since she separated from her husband she has been taking care of the family by herself, and her dream is to see them graduate. 

She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for five years, getting the capital from farming. Her major challenge is the rainy season that disrupts her business, and her vision is to own a boutique plus educating her children. Allen needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: In order to purchase an automatic lift jack.

loans.name: Jenny Ruth

texts.en:
Jenny Ruth is 43 years old and lives in Ozamis City. She is married with 2 children. She has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her store. Jenny Ruth has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Nong Taaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme Sylvie est la représentante du groupe NONG TAABA. Elle est  mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 7ans. Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits depuis 04ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 04 douzaine d’habits pour adulte; 05 douzaine de soutien gorge et 05 douzaine de complet pour enfants.

Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille avec ses économies. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique d’habits et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Ms. Sylvie is the leader of the group NONG TAABA. She is married and has two children. The older child is 10 and the younger is 7 years old. Her two children attend school and she has to take care of two people.

She has been selling clothes for four years. She buys her inventory at the market in sector 10. Her clients are women.

She wants to purchase four dozen sets of adult clothes; five dozen bras and five dozen children's outfits.

She wants to improve her familites living conditions with her savings. She strives to open a clothing store and to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase four dozen sets of adult clothes; five dozen bras and five dozen children's outfits

loans.name: Nadeema

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 41 years old, married and has four children.

Nadeema has been a tailor since 2002. She makes and repairs women’s and men’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good experience and she is well known in her area.

She decided to apply for a $900 loan to buy a tailoring machine and a small generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine and a small generator.

loans.name: Dirisa

texts.en:
Dirisa is 27 years old, married, and has three children, all living in a rented house in Masindi, Uganda. Dirisa's family's goal is to build a residential house and a commercial house for business. 

He has been a motorcyclist for six years, starting as a hired driver but later buying his own motorcycle from the meager income he got. Now he has two motorcycles. His hardships include high fuel prices and competition, nonetheless he wishes to own five motorcycles in the next six years.

Dirisa intends to buy a motorcycle with this loan since the sector is very profitable.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to boost his business

loans.name: Tiessiri Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe TIESSIRI III sont de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOUMATA la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  20.000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the TIESSIRI III group are married women with an average age of 29 and on average five children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the rural community of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice and peanuts. This is their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, FATOUMATA , the person in the middle in the seated row, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay for plowing to maintain about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The produce is sold at the markets of  Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after harvesting, to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of 20,000 F CFA, more or less, each crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Otgonchuluun

texts.en:
Otgonchuluun is 47 years old and lives with his wife and four of his children in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His older two sons, age 21 and 23, attend college while the younger four go to a secondary school. 

He manages a leather clothing making business with the help of his wife. With 15 years of business operation he gained much experience. He is a hardworking and delightful man who says, "I have many children. Therefore I need to work hard to better my living condition." He is requesting a 2,000,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase leather for his business.

loans.use: To purchase leather

loans.name: Paddy

texts.en:
Paddy is a forty-one-year-old married man with four children; he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been a farmer dealing in maize and poultry for twelve years. He acquired initial capital from his salary as a teacher. His hardships are the price fluctuations of maize, lack of enough capital, and prolonged drought. Nonetheless he longs to set up a food store and increase the size of his poultry farm, plus educate his children. 

Paddy needs the loan to buy poultry feed and hire labor to harvest his maize.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and hire labor to harvest his maize.

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is 46 years old and a widow. She lives in Adapazarı in her own house. She has three children. The eldest one is 26 and the youngest one is 18. She has a shop and has been dealing with sundries for one and a half years. Her clients are people in her village. At first, when she opened her shop, it was a very small one. Later on, she augmented her shop. Also, she has increased the number and the variety of her products. 

She wants to restore her shop in the following ways: she needs a whitewash, renovation of her floor, a new counter, and a dressing room for women (one of the most necessary things she lacks). The restoration of the shop would give the shop a new and more attractive appearance that would appeal to more clients. As a result, sales would increase. Her plan for the future is to open larger shops in her own town as well as other towns. She wants to marry off her son and see that her daughter finishes her education. Her biggest dream is to write a book one day. Lastly, Ayşe is always able to live by her own means without any support. In addition, she is an idealist, and is an ambitious and innovative person.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Ayşe 46 yaşında ve eşi vefat etmiş.Adapazarı'nda kendi evinde yaşıyor. Ayşe Hanım'ın üç çocuğu var, en büyüğü 26 ve en küçüğü 18 yaşındalar. Ayşe Hanım'ın kendine ait bir dükkanı var ve yaklaşık bir buçuk yıldır tuhafiye ile uğraşıyor. Müşterileri ise genelde yaşadığı köydeki insanlar. Ayşe Hanım dükkanını ilk açtığında küçük olmasına rağmen ilerleyen zamanlarda dükkanını genişletmiş, sattığı ürün miktarını ve çeşitliliğini arttırmış. 

Ayşe Hanım dükkanına boya badana yaptırmak, zeminini yeniletmek, yeni bir tezgah almak ve en önemli eksiği olan bir bayan giyinme kabini almak istiyor. Gelecek planları ise başka şehirlerde de yeni dükkanlar açabilmek ve birgün kitap yazabilmek. Son olarak, Ayşe Hanım her zaman kendi ayakları üzerinde durabilen, idealist ve hırslı bir kişilik olmuştur.

loans.use: to restore her shop and buy new products

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 35 years old, married to Joyce, and owns a retail shop which has been in operation for twelve years. He makes a monthly profit of 9,600 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by Kadet staff and has been given a loan of 60,000 KES from KADET Ltd. He plans to purchase unga (flour), rice, sugar, cooking fat, etc. 

From the anticipated profit he plans to add more stock to his shop. He hopes in the near future to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase unga (flour), rice, sugar, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira, 29, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband went to work in Russia to make money. Gulmira takes care of two children, both of whom are preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn additional money the family breeds livestock, fattens it and then resells it at a higher price. At the moment Gulmira's brother helps in running the business. Reselling livestock after fattening they earn an additional 5000 Kyrgyzstani soms per month. 

With money received from the loan Gulmira wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Gulmira wants to give her children a good education. 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line–People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan–Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Groupe Iv

texts.fr:
Les dix membres qui  constituent le groupe TIESSIRI IV sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, AWA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.  Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI IV comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members who constitute the group TIESSIRI IV are married women with an average age of 27 and on average 4 children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Koula, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco,  Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan,  AWA, the first person from the left in the seated row, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay plowing fees to manage about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. The women of the TIESSIRI IV group expect to make an average profit of about 20,000 F CFA per crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has four children. 

Ahmad has been an owner of a store since 1998, selling all kind of grains and chemical fertilizers. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children.

Najah has been an owner of a store selling shoes for women, men and kids since 2000. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate and to repair his store’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to make additional shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to renovate and to repair his store’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to make additional shelves.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 29 years old and single. He has been operating his quarrying business for three years. He has been loaned KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, and he will use the loan amount to purchase mining equipment for his business.

He will put the anticipated profit back into the business. He hopes to own his own quarry in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase mining equipment for his business.

loans.name: Katwekambe Farmers Group

texts.en:
Cornelius is a 49-year-old married man with 9 children between the ages of 27 and 3 years, who is living in his own semi-permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests solely on him, and his dream is to educate his children because he didn't go to school. 

He has been distilling alcohol for twenty years, and with the income generated he has been able to pay school fees for his children. He has the challenge of high license fees levied on the business. His desire is to increase his production at minimum cost. Cornelius needs the loan facility to help him continue to distill alcohol to sell.

loans.use: To distill alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years, married and has three children.

Saad has been an owner of a store selling and repairing computers since 2010. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,700 loan to renovate his store and to make a digital ad. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate his store and to make a digital ad.

loans.name: Wend Pa Welgde Group

texts.fr:
Mme Evelyne est la responsable du groupe WEND PA WELGDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans.02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des habits, des pagnes, des mèches et des pommades depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et aussi des hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 14complets pagnes.

Mme épargne ses économies et ambitionne voyager pour amener les habits et veut s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Ms. Evelyne is the leader of the group WEND PA WELGDE. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 8 and the youngest is 2 years old. Two of her children attend school and she takes care of four people.

She has been selling clothes, fabric skirts, hair extensions and lotions for nine years. She buys her inventory at the market in sector 10. Her clients are both men and women.

She wants to purchase 14 complete fabric skirts.

She saves her money and strives to travel to sell clothes and wants to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase 14 complete fabric skirts.

loans.name: Tulinawe Kyangwali Group

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 27-year-old hardworking man living in a permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. He has been dealing in a textile business for five years, and with the income earned he has been able to build a house for himself. He started with 500,000/=  shillings as working capital but now his stock is worth 3,000,000 shillings. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations. 

Wilfred hopes to set up a wholesale shop in the next five years. He needs a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Akbermet's Group

texts.en:
Akbermet is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband she is bringing up three sons. The first son is at school and the other two are preschool age (under seven). 

Two years ago, with an initial investment of 12,000 soms, Akbermet started to sell convenience goods such as sugar, soda, macaroni, etc. Her monthly profit is 7,000 soms. With the profits gained from the trade Akbermet increased the number of her livestock up to ten. 

She applied for this loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing strawberries and raspberries. Akbermet wants to prepare jam for the winter season. In the future she wants to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase strawberries and raspberries.

loans.name: Sabari Kadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Fatimata représente le groupe SABARI KADI. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Il a 04ans Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes depuis 10ans. Mme s’approvisionne au grand marché et au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 11 complets pagnes.

Mme épargne ses économies pour agrandir sa boutique. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto et voyager pour amener ses pagnes puis d’autres articles.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatimata is the leader of the group SABARI KADI. She is married and has one child. He is four years old and doesn't yet attend school. She is responsible for one person.

She has been selling fabric skirts for ten years. She buys her inventory at the Grand Marche and at the market in sector 10. Her clients are both men and women.

She wants to purchase 11 complete fabric skirts.

She plans to save money to grow her shop. She would like to purchase a motorbike and to travel to sell her fabric skirts and other articles.

loans.use: to purchase 11 complete fabric skirts

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has three children.
