The member is Señora Judith.  She is 34 years old and is single with 2 children.  The member combines her daily activities with the business of selling juice, which she sells in the market of the town of Cusco.  The member also has a car which she rents and uses to run a taxi service.  The member works in the business selling juice from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm, and by means of these businesses the member is moving her children ahead in life.

The member wants to expand her business selling juice and her transportation business; the partner wants to expand her business selling juice and her taxi service business.  The member is requesting the loan for the maintenance of her car, to buy spare parts and tires.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with repayments.

loans.use: to maintain her car and buy spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Khadiatu A

texts.en:
Khadiatu is 27 years old and married with one child, age seven. She runs a boutique in Grassfield, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also has three relatives she takes care of as well as her immediate one. 

Khadiatu has owned this business for five years and sells ladieswear, bags, menswear and bamako material at her boutique. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenges to her business are inflation in the dollar rate and customs difficulties.

She has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more boutique items, such as ladieswear, bags and menswear. Khadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her savings. In the future, she would like to expand her business to the provinces.

loans.use: to purchase more boutique items such as ladieswear, bags and menswear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, powders, lipstick and makeup.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Xequemeya Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Bernardina es soltera, tiene 18 años de edad, curso el quinto años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de tacos, actualmente cuenta con un puesto donde tiene demanda su negocio de tacos, inicio este negocio con una carreta de tacos y hasta el momento tiene 7 años de experiencia, ya que empezó desde que era una niña. En el futuro espera contar con 10puestos de venta y 10 carretas, por esa razón decide solicitar préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar ingredientes para los tacos: Carnes, maíz, aceite, cebollas, tomate, etc. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades: crianza de animales, comercio y a la sastrería.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Bernardina is single and 18 years old.  She studied through the fifth year of primary education, and works in trade, selling tacos.  She currently has a food stand where she operates her taco business.  She started this business with a taco cart and so far has 7 years experience, having started when she was a child. 

In the future she hopes to have 10 food stands and 10 food carts.  For that reason she decided to apply for the loan, which she will use to buy ingredients for the tacos: beef, corn, oil, onions, tomatoes, etc.  

The other group members engage in various activities: animal husbandry, trade and tailoring.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for selling tacos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo que queda en la provincia de Anta distrito de Mollepata que está situado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco, ella siembra manzanas y frejoles y luego los vende al por mayor en los diferentes mercados, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y también para pagar la movilidad de traslado de los productos de manzanas y frejoles para la ciudad de Cusco.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "SANTO DOMINGO".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Maria Elena, she is 42 years old and married with 2 children.  The member combines her daily activities with the business of agriculture; she has farmland in the province of Anta, in the district of Mollepata, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  She grows apples and beans, and then sells them at wholesale in different markets.  By means of this business, the member is moving her children forward in life.

The member wants to expand and improve her agriculture business. The member is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and also to pay for transporting the products of apples and beans to the city of Cusco.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the repayments of her share.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, and also to pay for transporting the products of apples and beans to the city of Cusco.

loans.name: Francis Antonio

texts.es:
Francis, vive con su esposa y un hijo, solamente él trabaja, inicio con su taller hace varios años, reparando motocicletas, uno de sus amigos le enseño el oficio, actualmente no tiene un horario fijo.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para las motocicletas, ya que por el momento está bien escaso de repuestos, lo que le puede ocasionar la perdida de algún cliente, la compra le ayudara para surtir el taller y mejorar su servicio.
Para Francis la mejor aspiración es que sea reconocido por su buen trabajo, aumentar su clientela y garantizarle a su familia un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Francis lives with his wife and son. He is the only one who works. He started his motorcycle repair shop several years ago. One of his friends taught him the trade. He does not have a fixed work schedule.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles because he does not have many spare parts at the moment and it has sometimes caused him to lose a customer. This purchase will help him to stock his workshop and to improve the service he provides.

Francis' greatest aspirations are to be recognized for his good work, to increase his clientele and to guarantee his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Juana acaba D. ser elegida presidenta D. su Alcancía Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, llamada así como muestra D. su fe hacia Jesucristo. 
Rosa Juana es conviviente y tiene cinco hijos, El negocio que ella lleva a cabo es el D. la compra y venta D. chatarrería, pero no empezó en ello D. la noche a la mañana, lo suyo fue algo progresivo. Había acumulado una buena cantidad D. objetos en su casa y estaba decidida a recolectar. A partir D. ese momento pasó a recolectar no solo en su casa sino en las calles, objeto que podía servirle, objeto que recogía y vendía; con el tiempo, con la idea D. que siempre en casa se botan latas, cuadernos, fierro y demás ofreció a sus  vecinos comprarles su "basura". Y desD. ese entonces Rosa lo convirtió en su negocio, al cual le pone mucho empeño; hasta su esposo que al principio se mostraba reacio a emprender esta actividad ahora se ha convertido en su mejor aliado.
Como resultado D. su esfuerzo ha logrado comprarse un terrenito que espera destinar como almacén.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Juana was just elected president of her communal bank, "Corazón D. Jesús" ["Heart of Jesus"], which is so-named to demonstrate their faith in Jesus Christ.

Rosa is in a common-law marriage and has five children, the oldest of which is financially independent and works to support the household. Rosa's business is buying and selling junk, but she did not come to do this work overnight. It was something gradual. She had accumulated a good amount of things in her house and was going to throw them out. However, some of the things were maD. of materials that could be reused, so she found a place that bought these types of items and sold them. From this moment on, she started collecting objects that could be useful, not only from her own house but on the streets. She collected these things and sold them. Over time, with the idea that households always throw out cans, notebooks, scrap metal, etc., she started offering to buy her neighbors' "trash." Ever since, Rosa has maD. this her business and she puts a great deal of effort into it. Her husband, who was reluctant at first, has now started to learn this type of work and has turned into her greatest ally.

As a result of her efforts, Rosa has been able to buy a small plot of land where she hopes to open a store.

loans.use: Para tener mayor poder adquisitivo a la hora de recibir mercadería

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants. But you'd never guess the size of the city from the tranquil pace of life in the city. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge market and its trade in livestock — the largest in the country.

Maria is 38 years old and has four children, aged 4, 11, 13 and 15. She had a difficult separation from her husband and now lives with her four kids. She shares her spare time with her children at home.

This is Maria's first Kiva loan. She'll use her loan to invest in more tables and chairs for the restaurant she and her mother run in Santo Domingo. Maria finds the most difficult part of her work is the cooking — she doesn't like it, but her work in the restaurant requires her to do it nearly all day. But buying addition seating for potential customers, Maria hopes she can increase her income and provide herself and her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more tables and chairs for a restaurant.

loans.name: Lugendo Group

texts.en:
Robert, who is in his mid 20s, is single.  He has been running a library business and a barber shop and selling music on telephones for three years now.  He works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to increase his business by buying more CDs, DVDs, VCDs and to buy one more shaving machine. His dream is to one day be able to buy land of his own.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Lugendo," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase on business  by buying more CDs, VCDs, DVDs and to buy one more shaving machine.

loans.name: Fredis Armando

texts.es:
Fredis, es carpintero, vive con su familia, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la fabricación de muebles, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00am a 5:00pm, el trabajo lo aprendió cuando trabajaba como empleado de una carpintería.
Por el momento necesita un préstamo que cubra el gasto de madera y pintura, los cuales son materiales necesarios para la fabricación,  esta compra le ayudara para fortalecer el taller y poder realizar los trabajos.
La aspiración de él es que su negocio se vuelva más fuerte, contar con más clientela, apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Fredis is a carpenter and lives with his family. He has been making furniture for seven years. His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. He learned his trade when he worked as an employee at a carpentry shop.

At the moment, he needs a loan to cover the expenses of wood and paint, which are necessary materials for his projects. This purchase will help Fredis to strengthen his workshop and to be able to complete his work.

His dreams are for his business to become stronger, to have more customers, and to support his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wood from different trees and various paint colors

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Lucio; el tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es propietario de un carro que realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere que termine de estudiar su hijo. 
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Santo Domingo" communal bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Mr. Lucio. He is 43 years old, in a common-law marriage and has three children. He divides his time between his daily activities and his transportation business. He is the owner of a car that he uses to provide taxi service throughout the streets of Cusco. Lucio works from 5:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. He hopes this business will allow his son to finish his studies.

Lucio his happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to pay his son's monthly school tuition and to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Brima

texts.en:
Brima is 47 years old and married with five children, ages between 1 and 18. He runs a liquor retail store in Lumley, a neighborhood in Freetown.

 Brima has been in this business for seven years and sells Pegapaks, Royal Stouts, Black Label and other types of alcohol at his store. He also earns income from transportation (truck).  He says that the main challenge to his business is, it takes time for the stock to reach him (delay of stock).

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase a variety of liquor to stock. Brima says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children. In the future, he would like to import liquor from overseas.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of liquors to stock (Heineken and Black Label wine).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, oil, corn, fried pigskin, cheese and drinks for her food sales business.

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Eulidia es la presidenta D. la Alcancía Comunal “Fe y Alegría”, conformada por 7 integrantes, el nombre lo eligieron porque la mayoría D. mamás que fundaron el grupo tenían a sus hijos estudiando en el colegio Fe y Alegría, además se sintieron identificadas con el significado D. estas palabras.
Eulidia es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y productos naturales por catálogo desD. hace más D. 8 años. Descubrió una habilidad especial para las ventas cuando una amiga le propuso vender los productos que inicialmente ella solo consumía. También atienD. en un kiosco dentro D. un colegio.
Eulidia sueña con mejorar las condiciones D. vida en su casa, primero con construir la pared D. la fachada con material noble, y luego “levantarla” hasta un segundo piso donD. poder asignarle cuartos independientes a sus hijos y poder abrir una bodega para estar cerca D. ellos y también colocar sus productos naturales. Ahora su terreno está construido solo con madera y calamina.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eulidia is the president of the “Faith and Happiness” Community Bank. It is maD. up of seven members. They chose this name because most of the women who founded this group have children studying at the school called “Faith and Happiness”. They also identify with the significance of these words.
Eulidia is married with two minor children. She sells beauty and natural products from a catalogue. She has been doing this for the past eight years. She discovered that she has a natural sales ability when a friend proposed to her that she might like to sell the products that she liked to use. She also has a booth in the school. Eulidia's dream is to have a better home. She would like to have an entryway maD. of oak. She also would like to add a second floor to her house where her children could have their own rooms. She would then be able to have a store in her house and also a place to store her natural products. Right now her house is maD. of wood and aluminum.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of products in order to have a greater available inventory.

loans.name: Esmeralda Yaneth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, es soltera, vive con su madre y hermanas, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene experiencia en la preparación de las tortillas así como para comercializarlas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, esta compra le ayudara para incrementar los materiales y poder tener disponibilidad para la ejecución de la venta.
Para ella su propósito es aumentar las ventas, con mayor número de clientes que le permitan estabilizar el negocio y generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is single and lives with her mother and sisters. She sells tortillas. She has experience both preparing and selling tortillas.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood. This purchase will help her to increase her materials and to be able to have them available to make sales.

Esmeralda's goal is to increase her sales with a greater number of customers, so that she can stabilize her business and generate better profits.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for preparing tortillas to sell

loans.name: Laura Martha

texts.es:
Al final de una callecita adoquinada en la parroquia "Río Verde" del cantón Santo Domingo se encuentra el pequeño restaurante de Laura, una mujer de 50 años madre de 4 hijos. Vive con su esposo Jorge que es albañil de 53 años y sus dos hijos menores de edad.

Su pequeño negocio lo abrió hace tres años, sus amistades le enseñaron a preparar comida rápida y así empezó. Su trabajo le ha ayudado a poder sustentar las necesidades de su familia. Hoy ella quiere comprar insumos de cocina para mejorar la presentación del negocio y de esta manera atraer mayor clientela. Por ello Fundación Alternativa la ayudó con un crédito el cual le permitirá lograr su objetivo.

A ella le aquejan problemas de salud por lo que esa es su mayor preocupación, ella quiere que tosa su familia pueda gozar de buena salud y algún día ver a sus dos hijos menores con un título profesional que les permita tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
At the end of a small cobbled street in Río Verde parish, canton of Santo Domingo, you would find the small restaurant that belongs to Laura, a 50 year-old woman and mother of four children.  She lives with her husband, Jorge, who is 53 years-old and a bricklayer, and their two youngest children.

Laura opened her small business three years ago. Her friends taught her to prepare fast food and this is how she got started. Her work has helped her be able to cover her family's necessities. Today, she would like to buy kitchen supplies to improve her business' presentation and thereby attract more customers. Fundación Alternativa is helping her with a loan that will allow her to achieve this goal.

Laura is plagued by health problems, which is her greatest worry. She wants her entire family to be able to enjoy good health and to someday see her two younger children with professional degrees that will allow them to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Irma Alicia

texts.es:
Irma, se dedica a la venta de CD y Dvd, vive con su esposo y sus nietos, inicio con el negocio aproximadamente hace 10 años, vende de lunes a domingo y su puesto esta en las principales calles de la ciudad.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de CD y DVD, también un televisor para hacer las pruebas a los clientes de las películas, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener en el negocio más mercadería y contar con las herramientas necesarias para poder vender.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, y algún día tener casa propia, para vivir dignamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Irma sells DVDs and CDs. She lives with her husband and grandchildren. She started her business approximately 10 years ago. She sells from Monday to Sunday and her stand is on one of the main streets of the city.

She is requesting a loan at this time to buy CDs and DVDs, as well as a television for showing the movies to her customers. This loan will help her to have more merchandise on hand for her business and to have the necessary tools to be able to make sales.

Her goal is to improve her business and to one day have her own house so that she and her family can live with dignity.

loans.use: to buy CDs, DVDs and a television for demonstrating products

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras, with her daughter and three grandchildren. For many years she has run a small convenience shop, as well as prepared and sold tamales and soup out of her home. 

Feliciana is requesting a loan of HNL 12,500 to purchase merchandise for her store as well as ingredients for making tamales and soup. She is a returning client and has used previous loans to build her business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, juices, milk, eggs, rice, beans, cornmeal, cooking oil, lard, firewood, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Adalgiza

texts.es: Adalgiza de 50 años se dedica a la pintura de cuadros,  fábrica cerámica  y vende prendas de plata mediante pedidos, a una clientela construida durante muchos años.  Ella vive en la ciudad de Cartagena,  es  una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 20 a 24 años, con quienes sueña ver exitosos ; hace 17 años con la liquidación de la empresa donde trabajaba, inicio su actividad emprendedora;  primero vendiendo pescado , luego mercancías y  como gradualmente tuvo mucha aceptación, aumentó su clientela y la aprovechó para ofrecerle artículos elaborados en cerámica, pues  también se dedica a pintar biscochos en este material,  que funcionan como recordatorios de primeras comuniones, fiestas infantiles , quinceañeros, grados , adornos  y adicionalmente  hace cuadros; Toda esta actividad le ha permitido desarrollar  su vena artística y por eso se siente muy feliz.  Este es el quinto financiamiento que hace Adalgiza a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar pintura y cerámicas y  venderla as a sus clientes sobre pedidos; con los anteriores financiamientos  ha logrado extender su negocio, aumentar sus ingresos y también el  bienestar de su familia. Con su nuevo capital de trabajo, logrará  impactar un nuevo mercado de clientes, pues esta es su meta y en ello tiene muy buena experiencia.
texts.en: Adalgiza is 50 years old. She paints pictures, makes ceramics, and sells silver jewelry to order to customers she has had for many years. She lives in the city of Cartagena and is a married mother of 2 children, aged 20 and 24. Her dream is for them to be successful. 17 years ago, with severance pay from a job she used to have in a business, she began her business activity. First she sold fish, later merchandise. Gradually she gained acceptance and built her clientele. She began to sell ceramic items. She also paints little ceramic cookies, which serve as souvenirs for first communions, children's parties, quinceañeras, graduations, and decorations. She also paints pictures. All of this activity has allowed her to develop her artistic talent and because of that she feels very happy. This is the fifth loan that Adalgiza has made with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It is to buy paint and ceramics and to sell to customers via orders they make. With the previous loans, she has been able to grow her business, increase her income and also her family's wellbeing. With her new capital, she will impact new customers. This is her goal and she has a lot of good experience in it.

loans.use: to buy paint and ceramics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura, tiene más de 20 años de estar en esta actividad cultivando pipián y maíz, aprendió por su padre que desde joven realiza las actividades agrícolas.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono para el cultivo, ya que la siembra está en la necesidad de recibir la fortaleza del abono para que produzca abundantemente.
Su propósito es que los dos cultivos le sean provechosos, que pueda generar buenas ventas con los frutos, y que su familia cuente con alimentación para un buen periodo.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children. He is a farmer, and he has been engaging in agriculture for more than 20 years, growing chilies and maize. He learnt from his father who has been working in the agriculture field since he was young.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure for his crops, as to produce an abundant harvest manure is needed to strengthen the crops.
He wants his two crops to be profitable, to gain a good income from the selling of their fruits and to have food his family can count on for a good period of time.

loans.use: To buy manure for his maize and chilies crops.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old and married with 4 children, ages 6 to 18. He runs a General Merchandise store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Samuel has been in this business for 10 years and sells drinks, milk and toothpaste at his shop. His business is the main source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is price fluctuations.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks, milk and provision items. Samuel says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to be a supplier to partners.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, milk and provision items.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her husband and three children. She operates a small convenience shop and is requesting a loan of HNL 8,000 to purchase merchandise. She is a returning client and is grateful for the support she has received from Prisma. She hopes to continue using income generated by the store to make home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, juices, milk, eggs, rice, beans, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Elizabeth; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de accesorios para carros, ella vende aceites, tornillos, parabrisas, llantas entre otros repuestos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de accesorios para carros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y accesorios para carros como tornillo, llantas y parabrisas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Santo Domingo". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Juana Elizabeth. She is 40 years old, single, and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her car accessories business. She sells motor oils, screws, windshield wipers, tires, and other spare parts. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and it is through this business that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her car accessories business. She requests a loan to purchase spare parts and accessories for cars, such as screws, tires, and windshield wipers in wholesale.

She is happy to have this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for cars, such as screws, tires, and windshield wipers in wholesale.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa vive en la ciudad de Managua.Trabaja  en el área de limpieza es madre soltera tiene cuatro persona a su cargo.

La señora Teresa acudió a nuestras oficina para solicitar un crédito por necesita pagar deudas que tiene pendiente con una institución bancaria de una tarjeta de crédito.
Agradece a ceprodel por es apoyo que se le brindo.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa lives in the city of Managua. She works in the janitorial field. She is a single mother and she has four individuals in her care.

Teresa approached our offices to request a loan because she needs to pay of loans debts that she has incurred with a financial institution through a credit card.

She is thankful to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for the support provided.

loans.use: to cancel a debt.

loans.name: Luz Daris

texts.es: Luz Daris  vive en el municipio de Arjona, municipio del departamento de Bolivar, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, motor de todos sus esfuerzos, que se encuentran  en las edades de 4 a 17 años.  Su negocio inició en su propia casa hace 6 años vendiendo comida a domicilio y especiales a través de la preparación de “buffets”,  para fiestas, repostería y como su negocio fue creciendo se trasladó a un local comercial, ubicado en la plaza principal de la población,  donde a través de una mejor exhibición y preparación de sus productos, ha logrado el reconocimiento razón  por la cual sus ventas se han incrementado y los productos  se terminan muy pronto. Su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograr hacer compras en mayor volumen y obtener descuentos que aumentarían sus utilidades. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará materias primas para la elaboración de sus productos además de jugos, bebidas frías licores y mecatos.  Su sueño es tener un negocio más en la vía principal  del pueblo instalando una especie de bohío que impacte la atención de sus clientes. Mientras da rienda suelta a su sueño y trabaja para lograrlo, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas, no menores del 27% y una rentabilidad sobre la inversión del 20,28%.
texts.en: Luz Daris lives in the municipality of Arjona. It is a municipality in the department of Bolivar. She is married and she has 3 children. They are the force behind her efforts and they are 4 and 17 years old. She started out her business six years ago from her own home, selling prepared foods in her home, catering parties in a buffet style, and baking pastries. And as her business increased she moved it to a commercial store space. It is located in the main town square where she has earned a wider recognition through better exhibition and preparation of her products. Her sales have increased and her products sell out quickly. Her working capital is not sufficient to make purchases in larger volumes and to obtain the discounts that would increase her yield. This is the reason why she requests a Kiva loan. It is the first loan she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With her loan she will purchase ingredients needed to make her products and to purchase juices, cold drinks, liquors, and spirits. Her dream is to have a business in a more central location in her town and installing a type of palm hut to attract the attention of her clients. While sets herself loose to pursue her dream and as she works to attain it, she observes a sales profit of no less than 27% and a profit margin of 20.28% on her investments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make her products and to purchase juices, cold drinks, liquors, and spirits.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su esposa y una hija, tienen casa propia, él se dedica a atender un car Wash, este negocio lo inicio hace 5 años, y ha logrado de sus ganancias mantener a su familia.
Él necesita el financiamiento para la compra de una máquina para lavar vehículos, pues quiere mejorar el servicio y atender a los clientes mejor, ya que tendrá mayor facilidad para agilizar el trabajo.
Mejorar el negocio es su objetivo, para obtener más ganancias y aumentar la clientela.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife and daughter. They have their own house. He works at a car wash. He started this business five years ago and his earnings take care of his family. 
He needs this loan to purchase a machine to wash the vehicles. He wants to improve his service and tend to his clients better. It will be easier to speed up his work.
Improving his business is his objective in order to earn more profit and increase his clientele.

loans.use: purchase a machine for washing vehicles.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erika; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia prepara platos como pollo al horno, estofado de pollo, sopas y entre otros platos, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la atención de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carnes, verduras y fideos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Erika belongs to the "Santo Domingo" village bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  

She is forty-four-years-old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She splits her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She cooks breakfasts, lunches, and dinners, making dishes like baked chicken, braised chicken, soups, etc.  Through her work she gets her children ahead.  She wants to grow and improve her restaurant.  

Erika is seekig a loan to buy ingredients wholesale, including chicken, meats, vegetables, and noodles.

She is happy to have the loan and is committed to making all her payments.

loans.use: This member is seeking a loan to buy cooking ingredients, like chicken, meat, vegetables, and noodles wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.en: Jose lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras where he operates a small convenience shop out of his home. He is requesting a loan of HNL 8,000 to purchase merchandise for the store. He is a new client and would like to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, juice, milk, eggs, beans, rice, cornmeal, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Marina Rosaura

texts.es:
Marina tiene 41 años es viuda vive en Tulcán con sus dos hijas que tienen 17 y 9 años, se decribe como buena amiga, trabajadora, dedicada a sus hijas y muy cariñosa con ellas.

Trabaja en la crianza de cerdos junto con su hija mayor, empezó a trabajar en la crianza hace 15 años porque vió que con la venta de cerdos hsbís buena rentabilidad.

Es el tercer crédito que solicita a FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para comprar una vaca porque quiere también ingresar al negocio de ganado, ya que aumentaría considerablemente sus ingresos y mejorarían la calidad de vida de sus padres y de sus hijas.

El sueño que tiene es que sus hjas sean bachilleres y puedan encontrar un buen trabajo, también un anhelo es el de incrementar su capital de trabajo y seguir cultivando su terreno.
texts.en:
Marina is 41 years old and a widow. She lives in Tulcán with her two daughters, ages 17 and 19. She describes herself as a good friend, a hardworking woman, dedicated and very loving to her daughters.

She raises pigs with her older daughter. She started to raise the pigs 15 years ago because she saw that the sale of pigs provided a good profit.

This is her third loan requested through FODEMI. This requested loan will be used to purchase a cow because she also wants to join the cattle business. She would increase her income considerably and improve the quality of life for her parents and her daughters. 

Her dream is that her children will earn high school diplomas and find good jobs. In addition, one of her dreams is to increase her working capital and to continue cultivating her land.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.es:
Los más coloridos y bonitos cobertores para camas hechos a mano en Santo Domingo son vendidos por Arcadia, una mujer de 51 años madre de dos hijos. Ella vive sola con su pequeño nieto de 5 años de quien se hizo cargo. Nos cuenta que su vida ha sido muy dura ya que crio sola a sus hijos que hoy en día no viven con ella. Ella siempre solvento sola los gastos del hogar y al mismo tiempo fue padre y madre de sus hijos.

Ella únicamente ha estudiado la primaria, y desde hace unos años se dedica a comprar y vender cobertores y juegos de cama tejidos, también sábanas y edredones. Empezó por iniciativa de sus amistades quienes la motivaron para que tome el negocio. Ella trabaja sola, en su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con su nieto y ver telenovelas. Ella desea hacer arreglos a su vivienda para lo cual solicitó un crédito en Fundación Alternativa.

Ella desea poder tener una casa más bonita y ayudar económicamente a sus dos hijos que ya no están con ella.
texts.en:
The prettiest and most colorful handmade blankets in Santo Domingo are sold by Arcadia, a fifty-one-year-old mother of two.  She lives alone with her little five-year-old grandson, for whom she was given responsibility.  She tells us that her life has been very hard because she raised her kids, who no longer live with her, by herself.  She always worked out household expenses while serving as both mother and father to her children.

Arcadia has has only a primary school education, and for some years has earned her living buying and selling knit blankets and bedspreads as well as comforters and sheets.  She started out at the initiative of her friends, who motivated her to start a business. She works by herself, and she likes to spend her free time with her grandson and watching soap operas. She requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa because she wants to do repairs on her house.

Arcadia would like to have a nicer house and help her two children, who no longer live with her.

loans.use: to do repairs on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new brands of auto lubricants to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more soap, cigarettes and mosquito spray.

loans.name: Yessenia Marisol

texts.es:
Yesenia, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 15 y 11 años, desde hace 10 años de dedica a la venta tortillas, contribuyendo con su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, para la preparación de la venta de tortillas, esta compra le ayudara para tener disponibilidad de materiales para no descuidar el negocio y continuar sirviendo a los clientes.
El principal propósito de ella es mantener el negocio estable para poder ayudar a sus hijos y que estos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Yesenia earns her living selling tortillas.  She lives with her husband and two children, 15 and 11.  She's been selling tortillas for 10 years, helping her husband pay household expenses.  

She is seeking a loan to buy corn and firewood so she can make tortillas to sell.  The purchases will help her get what she needs so she doesn't neglect her business and can keep serving customers.  

Yesenia's main intent is to keep the business stable and be able to help out her kids so they can better themselves.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for selling tortillas.

loans.name: Jose Tranquilino

texts.en: Jose lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras where he runs a small convenience shop. He wakes early each day and runs the store seven days a week. Jose is requesting a loan of HNL 15,000 to purchase merchandise for the shop. He would like to continue working with Prisma in the future to keep growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, corn, cornmeal, snacks, candy, soft drinks, juice, milk, eggs, bread, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Hugo Rene

texts.es:
Hugo, se dedica a la venta de medicinas, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, tienen casa propia, el negocio lo inicio hace 11 años cuando dejo su vida militar, decidió dedicarse al negocio para mantenerse ocupado.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de medicinas como antibióticos y vitaminas, para poder ofrecerles a los clientes mayor diversidad de medicamentos, logrando obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudan para solventar sus necesidades.
La aspiración de él es que su negocio le sea más rentable, tenerlo surtido de medicamentos, generar más demanda por los clientes, y que su familia tenga
texts.en:
Hugo works selling medicine. He lives with his wife and their two children. They have their own home. He started his business 11 years ago when he left his military career. He decided to start his business so that he could keep busy.

He now needs a loan to purchase medicine such as antibiotics and vitamins. This will enable him to offer his customers more diverse medications. He will be able to have a better income that will help him pay for what he needs.

His dream is that his business will be more profitable and that he will be able to keep it stocked with medications and generate more demand from his customers. Also he wants his family to have

loans.use: to purchase medicine, such as antibiotics and vitamins, for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase beverages such as sodas, beer, liquor, and packaged goods in bulk.

loans.name: Solidaridad De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: Angélica tiene 34 años de edad, pertenece al grupo de Solidaridad de Jicamarca con 8 integrantes, este grupo tiene un año y medio, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos menores de edad, que es el empuje para ella y su esposo en salir adelante. Ella trabaja en  una  moto taxi, tiene en el trabajo ya 4 años, inicialmente ella alquilaba la moto taxi, pero con el tiempo se compro su propia moto taxi y  todos los días sale a trabaja. Gracias a su esfuerzo y ala de su esposo ellos han podido lograr darles estudios a sus hijos y poder construir su casa. Ella comparte su trabajo con otro trabajo haciendo servicios de confección de polos, sus planes hacia el futuro es formar un taller de polos y que este sea conocido, con el préstamo reciente ella quiere regularizar los documentos para iniciar la confección de polos y para la compra de telas.
texts.en:
Angélica, 34, belongs to the “Solidaridad de Jicamarca” group which has 8 members.  This group is a year and a half old.  She’s married and has three minor children which are her and her husband’s impulse to get ahead.

She has been driving a mototaxi for four years.  Initially she leased the mototaxi but in time was able to buy her own and she goes out to work daily.  Thanks to her and her husband’s efforts they have managed to provide their children with an education and to build their house.

She has a second job manufacturing polo shirts.  Her plans for the future are to set up a polo shirt making shop that’s well known.  She wants to use the present loan to regularize the documents to start making polo shirts and to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric and to get the necessary permits for her business.

loans.name: Grace Aracelly

texts.en:
Grace is 19 years old and married. Grace is slightly estranged from her parents because they objected to her marriage. But she married for love and now lives with her husband Luis, a locksmith who is 18 years old.

Grace lives and works in Latacunga, a plateau town in Ecuador, capital of the Cotopaxi Province. Latacunga is known for its chilly weather and the presence of nearby Volcano Cotopaxi, an active volcano that has repeatedly damaged the city during eruptions.

This will be Maria's first Kiva loan. She will use her loan to buy more pigs and feed. She works several hours a day, helped by Luis. She hopes this loan will help boost their income and improve the quality of their future life together.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Gloria Alba

texts.es: Gloria D. 59 años vive en Arjona, un municipio del departamento D. Bolívar, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos en las edades D. 27 a 31 años D. edad. Gloria tiene un negocio donD. venD. forros,  chalecos, cascos y mangas y accesoR. para motociclistas,  que inició hace 6 años  vendiendo minutos  con un chaleco que decía “Llamadas”, y muchas personas D. este gremio, le preguntaron si ella vendía chalecos. D. allí salió la idea inicial D. comercializarlos, como le fue bien  le agregó otros productos como  en su negocio  accesoR. para motocicletas, cascos, y  adicionó vitrinas bien surtidas. Su negocio ha tenido un buen crecimiento y está entusiasmada en hacerlo crecer porque ve sus utilidades muy pronto, esta es la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva, para comprar D. contado y en mayor volumen materiales para fabricar chalecos y manijas, además D. una máquina D. coser con los cuales iniciara un proceso productivo ella misma  D. mejor calidad. Gloria ha recibido 6 créditos D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante 2 años,  con los cuales ha logrado progreso en su negocio. Mientras Gloria se esmera por alcanzar sus sueños en su negocio, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 42,9% con la cual proyecta seguir fortaleciendo sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Gloria, 59, lives in Arjona, a town in Bolívar Department.  She’s married and has three children whose ages range from 27 to 31 year.  

Gloria has a business where she sells accessories for motorcyclists: seat covers, vests, helmets and sleeves that she started six years ago selling vests that said “Llamadas” and lots of people who are into motorcycles asked her if she sold vests.  This is where the idea to sell them arose.  Since she did well, she decided to add other similar products, like helmets, to her motorcycle accessories business.  She installed well-stocked display cases. 

 Her business has been growing well and she’s excited to help it grow because she expects to see profits very soon.  This is why she’s calling on Kiva to pay cash for larger amounts of material to make vests and handles as well as to buy a sewing machine so that she can start manufacturing higher quality items herself.  

Gloria has received six loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo during the last two years that have helped her business progress.  While Gloria strives to reach her business dreams, she maintains a profit margin of no less than 42.9% that she foresees will continue to strengthen her family income.

loans.use: to pay cash for materials at wholesale and to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Josefina, La socia tiene 62 años D. edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 1 hijo D. 36 años D. edad, la socia se dedica  a la atención D. su tienda y depósito D. cervezas,  la socia también tiene un restaurante, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra D. insumos para el negocio al por mayor como aceite, arroz, fideos, la socia también comprara cubiertos y paltos para su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes y D. cubiertos y vasija para el negocio.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Josefina, 62, belongs to the “María Elena Moyano” communal bank that’s located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has a 36-year-old son.  She tends to her grocery store and beer warehouse.  She also has a restaurant.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients, like rice, oil and noodles, for the business at wholesale.  She also needs to buy cutlery and dinnerware for the business.  She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients, cutlery and dinnerware for the business.

She is grateful for the support she’ll be given and pledges to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, cutlery and dinnerware.

loans.name: Elga Eby

texts.en: Elga lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her three children. For the last seven years, she has operated a small business selling undergarments, shoes, and dishware at the local market. Elga is requesting a loan of HNL 15,000 to purchase undergarments, sandals, and dishware for her store. She hopes the loan she receives will help expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, sandals, and dishware.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es: Regina vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena y a sus 25 años D. edad, es toda una empresaria D. la microempresa; ella se dedica a la comercialización D. productos variados como cremas,  perfumes y ropa en general; negocio que inició desD. hace 4 años, cuando entró a la Universidad y requirió tener ingresos suficientes para sus gastos, que en su totalidad estaban a cargo D. su madre; así fue como inició construyendo un  mercado doméstico en este establecimiento y vendió a sus compañeros D. estudios  con excelentes resultado. A ella le ha ido tan bien, que se siente entusiasmada para continuar su crecimiento como persona y como empresaria. Esta es la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará ropa y perfumería en general, así  ganará descuentos, aumentará su capital D. trabajo y continuará fortaleciendo su sueño D. tener un almacén bien posicionado  y generando más ingresos y en el futuro muchos empleos.
texts.en:
Regina, 25, lives in the city of Cartagena.  She’s quite the entrepreneur in her micro business.  She sells various products like creams, perfumes and clothes in general, a business she started four years ago when she entered university and needed to earn income to cover expenses which her mother had to cover in their entirety.  This is how she started building a domestic market at the university selling to her classmates and obtaining excellent results.  

She’s done so well, in fact, that she feels excited about continuing to grow both as a person and as a businesswoman.  This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy clothes and perfumery in general.  She will earn discounts this way and will increase her working capital continuing to strengthen her dream of having a well-placed store in the future that generates more income and lots of jobs.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumery in general.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase office supplies and accessories to stock her display cases with merchandise.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Silvia que nació en la departamento de Apurímac (Perú), tiene 33 años de edad y tiene dos hijos y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades domésticas, Yo ayudo en la casa y mi esposo Hugo es albañil y trabaja construyendo casas, edificios y otras cosas más. Yo requiero el crédito para comprar herramientas y materiales para ayudar en el trabajo de mi esposo”.
texts.en:
The “Vamos Juntas” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for its tourism, its commerce and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven New Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is there.

We met Silvia there.  She was born in Apurímac Department (Perú) and she’s 33 years old.  She has two children and she tells us:

“Currently, I live in the city of Cusco which is also where I carry out my domestic activities.  I help at home and my husband’s a bricklayer working building houses, buildings and other things.  I need the loan to buy tools and supplies to help in my husband’s work.”

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Alfonso`s Group

texts.es:
Alfonso`s Group está conformado por tres miembros, el presidente es Alfonso.

Alfonso tiene 51 años vive en San Gabriel con su esposa y sus dos hijos los cuales tienen 25 y 19 años de edad y se decribe como una persona muy trabajadora ya que quiere sacar adelante su familia.

Trabaja en una pequeña carpintería con José donde procesa todo tipo de madera hace tres años aproximadamente.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja con FODEMI desde el 2009, el crédito que requiere es para la compra de una máquina cepilladora de madera para optimizar tiempo y realizar mejor su trabajo.

Con la compra de esta cepilladora mejoraría la calidad de su trabajo y tendría mayor clientela, su sueño es de tener su propio local para instalar de una mejor manera su carpintería y ayudar economicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso`s Group is made up of three members; the president is Alfonso.

Alfonso is 51 years old, and lives in San Gabriel with his wife and two sons who are 25 and 19.  He describes himself as a hard worker and one who wants to move his family ahead in life.

For about the last three years, he has been working in a small carpentry shop with José, where he works with all types of wood.

This is his second time working with FODEMI since 2009.  The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of a wood planing machine to optimize his time and allow him to do a better job.

By purchasing this planer, he will improve the quality of his work and have more customers.  His dream is to have his own premises to set up his carpentry shop in a better way, and to help his family financially.

loans.use: to buy a wood planing machine.

loans.name: Danilsa

texts.es:
Danilsa está aplicando a su segundo credikiva, con su anterior logró aumentar sus utilidades, porque compró esmaltes, tratamientos de belleza y vendió muy bien sus servicios. Hoy está solicitando su nueva financiación para comprar productos de belleza, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "contenta con los créditos recibidos y deseo  continúen apoyando con esta línea de crédito.”
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Danilsa ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/191413
texts.en:
Danilsa is applying for her second Kiva loan.  With her previous loan she succeeded in increasing her profits because she bought nail polish, beauty treatments and she marketed her services quite well.  

Today, she’s asking for a new loan to buy beauty supplies and to improve the condition of her home.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “I’m happy with the loans received and wish you to continue supporting this new line of credit.”

If you’d like to know Danilsa’s story, please click on this link: http://kiva.org/lend/191413

loans.use: to buy beauty products and to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Marlen Patricia

texts.en: Marlen lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her husband and two children. She runs a small convenience shop that is located in a strategic location and has a solid customer base. Marlen is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise for her store. She hopes to keep working with Prisma in the future in order to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, juices, milk, eggs, cornmeal, beans, rice, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mujeres De Patachaj Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Ramona es casada, tiene 52 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 1 D. los cuales estudia el nivel básico D. educación, se dedica a la confección D. tejidos: pantalones, blusas, faldas, etc. Inició este negocio  con deseos D. superación y prestando un poco D. capital, y hasta el momentos lleva 12 años D. experiencia, en el futuro espera agrandar su negocio y tener variedad D. ropa para la venta. DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar telas D. diferentes clases y colores. Las demás integrantes D. grupo se dedican a las actividades D.: Confección D. pantalones, faldas, blusas, tejido D. sabanas, y a la crianza D. animales.
texts.en: María Ramona is married and is 52 years old.  She never went to school.  She has six children one of which is in elementary school.  She is a weaver.  She makes pants, blouses, skirts, etc.  She started the business wanting to improve herself and borrowing a bit of capital.  To date, she has 12 years’ experience and hopes to enlarge the business in the future and to have a wiD. variety of clothes on sale.  She decided to organize a group to request a loan that will serve to buy fabric of different types and colors.  The other group members carry out various activities, such as: making pants, skirts, and blouses, weaving sheets and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen de 34 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena  con su esposo y sus hijos en las edades de 1  a 12 años. Allí tiene un negocio en un punto  muy comercial  donde vende de variedades de productos, mediante crédito y de contado; Igualmente para generar otros ingresos los fines de semana tiene otro negocio en el que le va muy bien,  de venta de comidas  rápidas cuya infraestructura física ubica en la puerta de su miscelánea. Como en su negocio hay productos que rotan muy rápidamente, ella para comprar debe esperar reunir un dinero, para responder a su clientela cuando la mercancía se termina, pues su capital de trabajo no es suficiente y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa para niñas, chancletas, accesorios para damas y para el hogar, y también útiles escolares y papelería en general. Con su inyección de este nuevo capital de trabajo financiará su cartera, y surtirá su negocio para que su clientela aumente, así como también sus ingresos que es su gran meta.
texts.en:
Carmen, 34, lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and two children who are 1 and 12 years old.  She has a business there at a commercial spot where she sells a large variety of products both for cash and on credit.  In order to generate extra income she has a weekend job that she does very well in: fast food sales.  This job’s infrastructure is a table she sets up at the entrance to her variety shop.

Her business has items that sell out quickly but she often has to wait until she’s amassed enough money to respond to customer demand when her merchandise runs out because her working capital is small.  This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan to buy clothes for girls, sandals, accessories for women and for the home and also school supplies and general stationery supplies.  With the injection of this new working capital she will finance her portfolio and stock her business so that her clientele will increase as well as her income which is her main goal.

loans.use: to buy girls' clothes, sandals, women's and home accessories, school supplies and general stationery supplies.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es: La señora Santa Catarina es casada, tiene 28 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 2 D. los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos como también al comercio ya que tiene una tienda D. venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo D. su esposo y lleva 6 años D. experiencia, su esposo se dedica a la confección D. tejidos. En el futuro espera ver su negocio más amplio y con mejores ganancias, por la misma razón deciD. organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital D. trabajo y compras más producto para la tienda que tiene, va a comprar: aguas gaseosas, golosinas, especias, alimentos en lata, azúcar, etc. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican: al comercio, a la confección D. ropa, a la tejeduría D. sabanas y a la crianza D. animales.
texts.en:
Señora Santa Catarina is married and 28 years old.  She has had no opportunity to study, and has 4 children, 2 of whom are at school.  She works doing domestic chores as well as in traD., as she has a shop selling everyday consumer items.  She started this business with the support of her husband and has 6 years of experience.  Her husband works in weaving.  

In the future, she hopes to see her business grow with better profits. For this same reaS., she decided to organize a group to apply for a loan that will broaden its working capital.  She will purchase products for her store.  She is going to buy: sodas, candy, spices, canned goods, sugar, etc.

Other group members work in traD., clothing manufacturing, linen weaving, and animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora  Catalina, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida  a tenido su negocio  desde  hace  dos años atrás .
Tiene dos hijos  Ricardo de tres años de edad  y  Luís Antonio de diez años de edad , su hijo Luís le ayuda  a lavar los trastes  y a comparar  las cosas que necesita , para que  a  Doña  Catalina no se le haga  tarde y le de tiempo de hacer guisados.
Su sueño mas grande  es  tener  un restaurante  ya que ha trabajado muchísimo  y tiene  ahorrado su dinero para los materiales que va  necesitar.
Esta  muy agradecida con fundacion por que  con el préstamo va comparar mas alimentos  ya que aparte de vender comida en su local va entregar comida a sus clientes  que trabajan en locales y en casas.
Su esposo le ayuda cuando sale de trabajar a limpiar y  acomodar las mesas  y la acompañ a comparar  lo necesario para el otro día y  su hijo Ricardo se encarga de  comprar las cosas del mercado.
Esta  agradecida con  sus hijos  que la han  apoyado y a fundacion por que con su  préstamo a alcanzado sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina works selling food.  She started her business two years ago.

She has two sons: Ricardo, aged three, and Luís Antonio, aged ten.  Her son Luís helps wash the dishes and buy the things required, so that Catalina does not have to work late and has time to make stews.

Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant as she has already worked very hard and has been saving her money for the supplies she will need.

She is very grateful to the Foundation for the loan, with which she will buy more food supplies, because apart from selling food on her premises, she also will deliver food to her customers who work in premises and homes.

Her husband helps when she goes to work cleaning and arranging the tables, and accompanying her to buy necessary items for the next day, and her son Ricardo is in charge of buying things from the market.

She is grateful to her sons who have supported her, and to the Foundation for the loan to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase and sell food.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
La señora Minerva es una señora muy trabajadora  se dedica a la venta de calzado, siempre le a gustado vender calzado por que le deja muy buena ganancia.
Tiene treinta cuatro años de edad, empezó a trabajar desde los veinte  años
Su esposo Luís  le ayudó a poner un local para la venta de zapatos ya que la señora Minerva  necesitaba  un local, ya que sale a la ciudad de Pinotepa a trabajar en una tortillería con su hijo Antonio, mientras ella esta en la ciudad de Pinotepa, su hija Luisa se queda a tendiendo la pequeña zapatería.
Tiene tres años vendiendo calzado y ahora quiere diversificar su negocio, quiere  vender ropa por que sus clientes le piden ropa y calzado ya que les da a buen precio.
Esta muy contenta con el préstamo que le ha dado fundación para salir adelante  con sus sueños esta muy agradecida con su esposo y  sus hijos.
Antes de v empezar a vender calzado lavaba trastes para  tener un poco  mas de  dinero para  cuando sacara sus pedidos.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Minerva is a very hard-working woman. Her work is selling shoes. She has always enjoyed selling shoes, because it gives her very good earnings. She is thirty-four years old, and she started working when she was twenty. Her husband Luís helped her set up a shop, since Minerva needed a business location in the city of Pinotepa, where she works with her son Antonio in a tortilla store, while her daughter Luisa stays to operate the shop. She is a very hard-working woman. 

She has sold shoes for three years, and she wants to sell clothing because her customers are asking for clothing as well as shoes, since she sells them at a good price. 

She is very happy about the loan, which has given her the foundation to get ahead with her dreams. She is very grateful to her husband and her children. Before she started selling shoes, she washed dishes to have a little more money for when she could start taking orders.

She thanks the foundation for supporting her in fulfilling her dreams. .

loans.use: para comprar zapatos y ropa para diversificar su negocio

loans.name: Ambrocia Eutiquia

texts.es:
La señora  Ambracia Eutiquia trabajaba vendiendo pollos, ella vende pollos desde hace cinco años, primero vendía  pollos de casa en casa después, empezó a vender en su casa pero con el apoyo de fundación ahora , vende sus pollos en el mercado y obtiene   muy buenas  ganancias.

Aparte de vender pollo vende  chicharones y dulces ya que vive cerca de una escuela y pasan los niños a comprar.

Es una señora que no vive con sus  hijos todos sus hijos ya están casados y uno esta en los estados unidos  solamente esta con su esposo, lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que  siempre trata de ganar  mas clientes es una persona muy amable , le gusta mucho trabajar  para cuando vuelvan sus hijos.

Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas pollos y obtener mas ganancias y asi poner una tienda de abarrotes para que cuando ya no pueda trabajar  atienda  desde su casa y no tenga que ir al mercado.

Su esposo Carlos le ayuda mucho en su negocio la va dejar al mercado y la va traer, están muy contentos con el préstamo y por lograr sus sueños y  haber  ayudado a sus hijos en sus estudios y por que fundación les ha ayuda a ellos para  salir adelante cuando mas lo  necesitaban.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación por ayudarles  a las personas que  desean mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
Ambracia Eutiquia has been working selling chickens. She has sold chickens for the past five years. First, she sold chickens from house to house, and then she started selling them from her house, but with the help of the Foundation, she now sells her chickens at the market and obtains very good earnings. 

In addition to selling chickens, she also sells fried snacks and sweets, since she lives close to a school and the children pass by and buy from her. 

She is a woman who does not live with her children; all of her children are already married, and one is in the United States, so she lives only with her husband. What she likes most about her work is that she is always trying to win more customers. She is a very friendly person who really enjoys working, looking toward the day when her children return. 

She requested the loan because she is not planning to sell chickens anymore, because she is getting older. She would like to set up a grocery store, so that when she cannot go out to work anymore, she will have the store in her home and will not have to go to the market. 

Her husband Carlos helps her a lot in her business; he drops her off at the market and comes back to pick her up. They are very happy about the loan, about achieving their dreams, and about having helped their children with their studies. They are also happy that the Foundation helped them get ahead when they needed it most. 

She is very grateful to the Foundation for helping people who want to improve their lives.

loans.use: to sell chickens.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe De Santa Clara Group

texts.es: Yrene es una mujer soltera D. 36 años con una sola hija, y pertenece  a un nuevo grupo llamado Virgen D. Guadalupe D. Santa Clara, con 8 integrantes, son personas creativas y empeñosas en sus propios trabajos. Yrene  tiene su negocio D. ventas D. abarrotes y gaseosas hace 2 años, todo empezó vendiendo golosinas en una carpa afuera D. su casa, también comparte el negocio con la venta D. ropa a pedidos y productos D. belleza, hasta ahora ha logrado darle educación a su hija y ha hecho la compra D. su refrigeradora para su negocio, con el reciente préstamo piensa en invertir en la compra D. mas productos para su bodega.
texts.en: Yrene is a 36-year old single woman who has only one daughter. She belongs to a new, 8-member group called Virgen D. Guadalupe D. Santa Clara. They are creative and hardworking people who invest themselves in their respective businesses. Yrene has had a grocery store and soft drinks business for the past 2 years. She started out selling snacks from a stand outsiD. her house. As a part of her business she also sells clothing based on orders and beauty products. Her success to date has been her daughter's education and the purchase of a refrigerator for her business.  With this new loan she will invest in the purchase of more products for her store.

loans.use: to purchase general store products.

loans.name: Cecilia  Indalecia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia se dedica a la  venta de antojitos  mexicanos estudio hasta tercer grado de la primaria , tiene un total de cuatro hijos dos mujeres y dos varones, desde hace tres años se ha dedicado a vender antojitos en las noches.
Doña Cecilia es una señora muy trabajadora a parte de vender antojitos mexicanos, se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo, le gusta tener sus propio negocio por que así ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Sus clientes le recomiendan  que ponga un local mas grande por que cuando van a  cenar están muy apretados, ella pidió el préstamo para  hacer mas grande su local y sus clientes se sientan a gusto ya que van todos los días a cenar y se merecen estar comodos.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Cecilia sells Mexican fast food snacks.  She went up to third grade.  She has a total of four children: two girls and two boys.  She’s sold fast food at night for the last three years.

Cecilia is a very hardworking woman.  Aside from selling Mexican fast food snacks she also sells shoes via catalogue.  She likes having her own business because she helps her husband cover household expenses and her children with their schooling that way.

Her customers have recommended that she enlarge her locale because when they go to have dinner they are too crowded.  She requested the loan to enlarge the locale so that her customers will be comfortable since they come every day to have dinner and they deserve to be comfortable.

She thanks the foundation for the support it’s given her to get ahead and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to enlarge her food stand.

loans.name: Vicenta Jacinta

texts.es:
La  señora  Vicenta ella se dedica a  la venta  de refrescos, estudio hasta sexto grado de primaria , tiene  un total de dos hijas ,desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a vender  refrescos y dulces .
Ala señora  Vicenta  le gusta   tejer manteles  las personas que tiene compromisos como casamientos la contratan para que les teje sus servilletas y sus manteles.
Le gustaría  poner un mini súper para que obtenga mas ganancias y ayudar a sus hijas para que terminen sus estudios y tengan una mejor calidad de vida  y no tengan que  sufrir para ganarse el pan.
Sus cliente le recomiendan que  se dedique hacer manteles y los venda ya que teje muy bonito.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  la compra de  refresco ya que se vende muy bien.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Vicenta sells soft-drinks.  She studied up to sixth grade.  She has two daughters.  She’s been selling soft-drinks and candy for two years.

Vicenta likes to knit tablecloths.  People who have social events like weddings contract her to knit their napkins and tablecloths.

She would like to set up a minimart to earn higher profits and help her daughters finish their schooling and have a better quality of life and not have to suffer in order to earn their daily bread.

Her customers have recommended that she focus on making the tablecloths to sell because she knits quite beautifully.

She asked for the loan to buy soft-drinks because they sell quite well.

She thanks the foundation for the support it’s given her to get ahead and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora  Esperanza se dedica a la venta de zapatos  , estudio hasta  la secundaria terminada , tiene un total de  tres hijos una mujer dos varones  desde  hace cinco años se ha dedicado a vender zapatos .
A la señora  Esperanza  le gusta mucho vender calzado por que tiene buenas ganancias  pero aparte de todo cuando ella desea comprar  zapatos para  sus  hijos , se lo dan a mitad de precio, le gusta mucho tener su negocio por que ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa.
Le gustaría  poner su propia zapatería ya que vende, muy bien  , y en su casa  luego no puede exhibir bien los calzado y  como los tiene  en una bodega . Sus clientes le recomiendan  que ponga su zapatería para que cuando vayan a comprar ellos vean lo que tiene.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  hacer mas grande su local y vender bolsas y  zapatos.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a woman dedicated to shoe sales.  She completed middle school and has a total of three children: one girl and two boys.  She’s sold shoes for five years.

Esperanza enjoys selling shoes very much because profits are good but, above all, when she needs to buy her children shoes she gets them at half price.  She likes having her business because she helps her husband meet household expenses.

She would like to set up her own shoe store because she sells quite well and she’s not able to display the shoes as well at home as she could in a store.  Her customers have recommended that she open a shoe store so that when they come by to buy they can see everything she has in stock.

She asked for the loan to enlarge her locale to sell purses and shoes.

She thanks the foundation for the support it’s given her to get ahead and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Doris Estela

texts.es:
Doris, vive con sus dos hijos,  se dedica a la venta de ropa, el negocio lo inicio hace un año, vende de forma ambulante todos los días de la semana, dicho negocio surge por la necesidad que enfrentaba al lado de sus hijos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa al por mayor, obteniendo blusas, faldas, ropa interior y más prendas de vestir que son necesarias, este préstamo le ayudara para surtir el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio rentable, mejorar los ingresos de su familia y ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios para que se puedan superar.
texts.en:
Doris lives with her two children.  She sells clothes.  She started the business a year ago.  She’s a street vendor and works every day.  The business arose out of the need she faced alongside her children.

At present, she requests a loan to buy clothes at wholesale.  She wants to get blouses, skirts, underwear and other articles of clothing that are necessary.  The loan will help her stock the business and sell to her customers.

Her goal is to have a profitable business, to improve her family income and to help her children with their schooling so that they can improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Araceli  estudio hasta  tercer grado  de la primaria , y tiene un total  de tres hijos  una mujer y dos varones .Ella se dedica  a la  venta de ropa , tiene   cuatro años  vendiendo  ropa  , tiene  muy buenos clientes ya que  la ropa las da en pagos , es una señora  muy trabajadora  en las noches  se dedica a vende antojitos mexicanos.
Sus hijos  le ayudan   atendiendo  a los clientes  y limpiando las mesas , doña Araceli esta muy agradecida con su esposo  Héctor  por el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir adelante  ya que cuando se trata  de  problemas hay esta el para apoyarla.
Sus clientes le recomiendan que ponga una tienda de ropa ya que vende  ropa  muy bonita , para toda ocasión y tiene buenos gustos  cuando pide ropa extra.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para  comprar mas ropa  y obtener mas ganancias  para  construir su tienda .
 Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Araceli studied through the third grade of primary school and has a total of three children; a daughter and two sons.  She works selling clothes.  She has been selling clothes for four years.  She has very good customers and gives them the clothes in return for payment.  She is a hardworking woman who works in the evenings selling Mexican food.  Her children help her with serving customers and clearing tables.  Señora Araceli is very grateful to her husband Hector for the support he has given her in getting ahead in life, because when it comes to problems, he is there to support her.

Her customers have recommended that she get a clothes shop because she sells very nice clothes for every occasion, and has good taste when she requests additional clothing.  She asked for the loan to buy more clothes and get more profits to build her store.

She thanks the foundation for the support that it has given her to get ahead in life and realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, sheets and towels

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su padre y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, inicio el negocio hace 6 años, ya que pertenecía inicialmente a su madre, y está enfermo, dejándola a Rosa como encargada para atenderlo.
