Uno de sus sueños  es   crecer su negocio y ver el fruto de sus ganancias  para seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que terminen una licenciatura .
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado , para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños  que tenia para el futuro  y gracias a su apoyo  los esta haciendo realidad
texts.en:
Irma, 35, has been making hand-made tortillas for the last 8 years.  She is a very hardworking woman.  Aside from selling hand-made tortillas she also sells stewed meat filled tacos.  She goes out every morning to sell her tacos to stores, stands and banks.

She has four children: two girls, Adriana, 10, and Lorena, 15, and two boys, Luis, 18 and Roberto, 21.

She is very happy because her business has been growing.  To date, she has twice as many customers as last year.  Her tacos and her tortillas have produced good profits and she’s been able to help her husband with household expenses and her children with their school expenses.

She asked for the loan to buy more corn to make tortillas because she runs out of them quickly because her customers ask for quite a few of them because they are quite delicious.

Her daughters, Adriana and Lorena, help her make the tortillas and the tacos and accompany her to sell them to the stands and to the banks; she also home delivers orders.

One of her dreams is to see her business grow with the fruit of her profits to continue supporting her children so that they will complete their Bachelor Degrees.

She thanks the foundation for the support its given her to get ahead and help the dreams she has for the future come true; thanks to its support they are becoming reality.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Felisa Magaly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Felisa, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos de 15, 13, 10 y 7 años de edad, dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y tarjetas telefónicas. Trabaja los fines de semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Sus productos los recibe en su casa. Lleva diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes tanto de hombre como de damas ya que son muy buenos.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y tarjetas telefónicas. Este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Camino Al Progreso [Road to Progress] community bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial tradition and for its artisanal crafts at the national and international level. It is where the famous paja toquilla hats come from.

This is where Felisa lives. She is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, aged 15, 13, 10 and 7. The two oldest go to high school and the youngest are in elementary school. Her husband is a bricklayer.  

She is a housewife who to make her own income sells clothes via catalogue, Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories ) as well as telephone cards. She works weekends, selling her products on credit and collecting every Sunday. She receives the products in her home. She has been doing this activity for ten years and it is going very well for her. What she sells the most are mens and women's perfume, which are very good. 
	
This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothes and telephone cards. This is her sixth cycle in the community bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. 
 
Her dream is to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, clothes and telephone cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Virgina

texts.es:
La señora Virginia  tiene cincuenta y ocho años de edad , se dedica a la  elaboración de antojitos mexicanos  desde hace  tres años atrás.
Es una señora  muy trabajadora  a parte  de vender antojitos mexicanos  se dedica  a la venta de carnes frías.
Tiene  la cantidad de cinco hijos  mayores de edad todos varones: Juan Carlos , Ricardo, Jesús , Eleazar y Fernando.
Esta muy contenta por que  su negocio va creciendo cada  día  mas, sus clientes están muy contentos por el servicio que les da , como echa esta contenta y agradecida por el servicio que el ha dado fundición realidad para salir adelante .
Pidió el préstamo para  comprar mas ingredientes para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos  ya que vende muy bien  a sus clientes  le gusta su comida ya que tiene buen sazón.
Sus hijos van a ayudarla  para , atender a los clientes  y alimpiar las mesas esta agradecida con dios por todo lo que le ha dado  para valorar las cosas  y a fundación realidad  por el apoyo  que le ha brindado  para hacer sus sueños realidad.
texts.en:
Señora Virginia is 58 years old.  She has been earning a living making "antojitos mexicanos" (typical Mexican snacks) for the last three years.
Señora Virginia is a very hard-working woman.  Besides selling her snacks, she sells fried meats.
She has five children, all grown boys: Juan Carlos, Ricardo, Jesús, Eleazar and Fernando.
Señora Virginia is very  happy because her business is growing daily.  Her customers are very happy because of the good service they receive.  As such, Señora Virginia is happy with and thankful for Fundación Realidad's services in helping her to get ahead.
She requested the loan to purchase more ingredients to make her snacks, since they sell well.  Her customers like her food, as it is flavorful.
Señora Virginia's children are going to help her attend to the customers and to expand her tables.  She thanks god for everything she has been given and for her appreciation of things.  She also thanks Fundación Realidad for the support they have offered her in making her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making "Antojitos Mexicanos" (typical Mexican snacks).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase essences, spices and clothing: blouses, skirts and formal tops.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar vive en la ciudad de Managua dedicandose a trabajar en su centro de labores. Es una persona responsable en su trabajo, es soltero y con muchas expectativas de desarrollo personal.

Es importante destacar que Julio también estudia por lo que solicitó un crédito para la compra de una computadora para facilitar sus estudios. Espera ser beneficiado con dicho crédito para así continuar superandose en su desarrollo como persona.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Cesar lives in the city of Managua and works as a laborer.  He is responsible in his work.  He is single and has high hopes of personal development.

It is important to note that Julio is also a student, and for this reason is asking for a loan to buy a computer to make it easier to study. He hopes to benefit from said loan in order to continue developing as a person.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his studies.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
La señora  Araceli  tiene veintiocho años de edad , se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace cinca años atrás .
Es una señora muy trabajadora a parte de vender  ropa se dedica a la venta de perfumes  ya  que le deja muy buenas ganancias  y cuando hay promociones  sus clientas le piden mas  y obtiene productos gratis.
Tiene la cantidad  de dos hijos una  mujer Fátima de diez años de edad y Luis Ángel de   siete años de edad .
Esta muy contenta  por que su negocio va creciendo cada día mas , sus clientes  están muy contentos con la ropa que les vende  ya  que le da a buen precio  y buena calidad.
Pidió el préstamo para la comprar mas ropa ya que luego se le termina  y necesita meter mas pedidos.
Uno de sus sueños es  que sus hijos tengan una licenciatura  y puedan lograr los sueños que se propongan.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado , para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños  que tenia para el futuro  y gracias a su apoyo  los esta haciendo realidad
texts.en:
Señora Araceli is 28 years old.  She has made her living selling clothing for the last five years.
Señora Araceli is a very hard-working woman.  Besides selling clothing, she also sells perfumes, which grants her good earnings.  When she offers promotions, her clients order more and are given free products.
She has two children, a little girl, Fátima, who is ten years old, and Luis Ángel, who is seven years old.
Señora Araceli is very happy because her business is growing more every day.  Her clients are very happy with clothing she sells to them, as it is good quality at a good price.
She requested the loan in order to purchase more clothing, since she runs out quickly and needs more to keep up with her orders.
One of Señora Araceli's dreams is that her children get their degrees and are able to achieve all their dreams.
She is thankful to the Foundation for the support they have given her in getting ahead and realizing her future dreams.  Thanks to their support, those dreams are becoming a reality.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase "family shopping basket" items and various merchandise such as women's accessories.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
1.	Teresa es una señora de 51 años que vive con su esposo e hijos en un pequeño pueblo en Guanacaste llamado la Garita. La Garita es una planicie de clima bastante cálido donde se desarrollan actividades tales como la ganadería, Agricultura y el Turismo Rural.

Desde hace varios años Teresa se dedica a la gastronomía, ya que tiene a cargo la cocina de una escuela privada, los vecinos de su comunidad se muestran muy satisfechos por el servicio brindado. Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

Actualmente Doña Teresa está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de repuestos de automóvil, para arreglar el medio de transporte que le facilita su trabajo. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. 

Doña Teresa es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito, y espera poder seguir participando de manera más activa en este tipo de organizaciones.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 51 year old woman who lives with her husband and children in a small town in Guanacaste called la Garita. La Garita ia on a plain that is very hot. People work in cattle, farming and tourism there. 

For several years, Teresa has made food. She is in charge of the kitchen of a small private school. The residents of his community are very satisfied with the service she has offered. She says that she has the support of her husband, who helps her continue with the project. She also says that the project is very interesting, since she has seen her business grow little by little and the demand get stronger.  

At present, Teresa is asking for a micro loan of ¢500.000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy replacement parts for her car, to fix her transportation for work. With this, she hopes to grow her business more and improve her quality of life. Her business is going well but due to lack of money, she hasn't been able to make it grow more.  

Teresa is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she hopes to keep participating in a more active way in this type of organization.

loans.use: buy replacement part for her transportation for work.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora    Maria de Lourdes, tiene  cuarenta y dos años de edad, estudio hasta la primaria terminada sabe leer muy bien le gustan las matemáticas.
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  dos mujeres  Lourdes de  trece años y Lorena   de dieciocho años y Gerardo de once años de edad.
Ella se dedica  se dedica  a la venta de ropa desde hace cinco  años atrás  y necesita  el préstamo para   comprar mas ropa ya que vende muy bien, también hace uniformes escolares. 
Sus clientes están muy contentos  por el trabajo que les ofrece ya  que la ropa se las entrega el día preciso.
Uno de sus sueños es tener una  de ropa  para  obtener más ganancias y engrandecer su negocio.
Le da las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  y hacer  realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes is 42 years old and has an elementary school education.  She knows how to read very well, and she enjoys math.

She has 3 children, of whom two are girls; they are: Lourdes, 13, Lorena, 18, and Gerardo, 11.  

Maria started selling clothing 5 years ago, and she needs a loan to buy more clothing since it sells very well.  In addition, she makes school uniforms.  Her customers are very pleased with her work, since she delivers the clothing exactly on time. 

One of her dreams is to have more clothing so that she can have more earnings and expand her business.  She thanks the Fundacion Realidad for the support that they have given her to help her to get ahead and to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing

loans.name: Karen Sofia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la Señorita Karen, tiene 21 años  de edad, es  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, nuestra amiga estudia para Lic. en Comunicación en la Universidad Laica de Manta. Lleva en el Banco Comunal tres ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido emprender un negocio que le da para solventar los gastos de sus estudios.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería de la marca Visón, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en la universidad donde estudia a sus compañeras de clases y conocidos, nos cuenta que le realizan muchos pedidos sus compañeras, además también aprovecha todos sus ratos libres para realizar sus ventas. Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la recibe en su casa ya que una señora le entrega allí. Tiene dos  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y bisutería.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios  y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The Camino Al Progreso ["Path to Progress"] communal bank meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized on the national and international levels. This is the home of the famous hats ["Panama" hats] made of paja toquilla fibers.

In this place lives Karen, a young lady of 21. She is single and lives in her parents' home. She is studying for a degree in communications at the Lay University of Manta. She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles, and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she has been able to operate a business which has given her the means to pay the expenses for her studies. 

She works selling clothing of all types, as well as Visón brand costume jewelry. Her sales method is door to door, and she also sells to her classmates and acquaintances at the university where she studies. She reports that her classmates place many orders. She also takes advantage of every free moment to make her sales. She provides goods to her customers on credit and collects payments every fifteen days. She receives her merchandise at her home, since a woman delivers it to her there. She has done this work for two years, and it is going very well for her. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and costume jewelry. 

Her dreams are to finish her studies and be a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La  señora  Ángela, tiene  treinta y ocho años de  edad , estudio  hasta la secundaria terminada  sabe  leer muy bien le gusta mucho  escribir.
Tiene la cantidad de  dos hijos una mujer  Alondra de  veinte años de edad y Rubén de   diez años de edad.
Ella se dedica a la  venta de abarrotes por  mayoreo y menudeo  desde hace cinco años atrás.
Sus clientes están muy contentos por la mercancía que les vende ya que esta  en  buen estado  y le da la mercancía  al momento.
Uno de sus sueños es hacer su mercancía mas grande es hacer mas grande su tienda de abarrotes  para que sus hijos la administren.
Le da las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  y hacer  realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Angela, 38, studied through the end of high school and knows how to read well and really likes to write. She has 2 children - Alondra, 20, and Ruben, 10. 

For 5 years she has sold groceries in bulk and smaller quantities. Her customers are very happy with her merchandise because it's in good condition and she gives them the up-to-date goods. One of her dreams is to increase the quantity of merchandise and make her grocery store bigger so that her children can manage it. 

She thanks the foundation for the support they have given her to get ahead and make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María es madre D. familia D. 55 años D. edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María se dedica desD. hace varios años a la crianza y comercialización D. ganado ovino (cuenta con 15 ovejas), su corral es amplio lo tiene a unos minutos D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos  naturales, una vez que lleguen a su peso  y tamaño ideal lo ofrece a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga pueD. solventar los gastos D. su hogar.  Tambien cuentacon tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa y es otro ingreso que obtiene.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras, con la finalidad D. que obtenga un buen precio por ambos productos que ofrece y así pueda tener mayores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  María es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a su familia que lo único que quiere es poderles brindar estudios superiores a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria, 55, is a mother who lives with her children in their own home which doesn't have basic services. Their house is located in the district of TambogranD. which is in the department of Piura, an area that is known for agricultural activity, cattle and artisan crafts. 

For some years Maria has raised and sold sheep (she has 15). Her corral is large and located a few minutes from her home. She feeds them balanced food and grasses. Once they reach the ideal weight and size she offers them to her customers and with the income she can cover the costs of her home. She also has farm land where she plants limes which she sells for extra income once they're harvested. 

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles to buy more balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers to improve her land, with the objective of getting a good price for both products and thereby having more profits to improve her quality of life. Maria is hardworking and dedicated to her family. All that she wants is to be able to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers to improve her lands.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La  señora  Fidela, tiene  cuarenta y dos años de edad, estudio hasta la primaria terminada  casi no sabe leer muy bien pero, le gustan mucho las matemáticas.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos    una mujer   Lourdes  y dos varones Fidel y Carlos  quienes  apoyan en  cualquier decisión.
Ella se dedica a la venta  de carnes frías  desde  hace  doce años  atrás con su esposo Joel  con quien lleva, casada   veinte dos  años.
Sus clientes  están muy contentos por la calidad de su carne  y por la atención que les da  y por la comprensión ya que  cuando sus clientes no tienen  dinero la  señora Fidela, les da fiado.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener una carnicería más grande ya  desea, darle  lo mejor a sus, para que terminen una licenciatura.
 Le da las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  y hacer  realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Fidela, 42, completed primary school. She doesn't know how to read very well, but she really likes math. She has 3 children - Lourdes, Fidel and Carlos, who she supports in all their decisions. 

For 12 years she has sold cold cuts along with her husband of 22 years, Joel. Her customers are very happy with the quality of her meat and the service that she provides, as well as the understanding that when her customers don't have money Fidela will sell to them on credit. 

One of her dreams is to have a larger butcher shop because she wants to give the best to her children so that they can receive a college degree. She thanks the Foundation Realidad for the support they have given her to get ahead and make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to sell cold cuts.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La  señora  Benedicta, tiene  treinta y nueve años de edad, estudio hasta la primaria terminada  casi no sabe leer muy bien, pero le gustan mucho las matemáticas.
Tiene tres hijos una mujer Maria y dos varones Daniel y Carlos quienes  apoyan en cualquier decisión que ella tome.
Ella se dedica a la venta  de carnes frías  desde  hace  nueve  años, con su esposo  Gustavo con quien lleva casada 19 años.
Sus clientes  están muy contentos por la calidad de su carne  y por la atención que les da  y por la comprensión ya que  cuando sus clientes no tienen  dinero la  señora Benedicta , les da fiado.
Ella pidio el prestamo para la comprar  mas vacas ya que entrega carne por mayoreo y asi obtiene mas ganancias para  cumplir sus sueños.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener una carnicería más grande ya  desea, darle  lo mejor a sus hijos , para que terminen una licenciatura.
 Le da las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  y hacer  realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Ms. Benedicta is 39 years old and finished primary school. She does not know how to read very well but likes mathematics a lot.

She has three children: one girl, María, and two boys, Daniel and Carlos, who support her in every decision she makes.

She has been selling cold cuts for nine years, alongside her husband, Gustavo. They have been married for 19 years.

Her customers are very satisfied with the quality of her meat, the service she provides, and her understanding. When her customers do not have enough money, Benedicta will sell to them on credit.

One of her dreams is to have a larger butcher shop. She also hopes to give her children the best so that they can earn college degrees. She is grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support they have provided to help her get ahead and make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy and sell meat.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora  Esther   tiene treinta y ocho años  de edad, se dedica  a la venta de ropa  desde  hace siete años atrás  con su  esposo , Lorenzo que  tiene  la edad de  cuarenta  y dos años .
Es  una señora muy trabajadora le gusta ayudar a su esposo en lo necesario  cuando su esposo va a ordeñar va con el al campo y  regresando guaja la leche  y se dedica hacer los quesos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  comprar mas ropa ya que rápido se  le termina , y sus clientes  le hacen pedidos y no cuenta con el dinero  suficiente para  cubrir los gasto de envidio de tallas.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos una mujer  Francisca  Yesenia  de doce años de edad  y dos varones Gilberto de  nueve años de edad y Daniel  de  tres años  de edad .
Esta muy contenta con  su negocio   por que cada día va ganando mas clientes  y su negocio va creciendo , le  gusta mucho tener su propio  negocio por que  le ayuda a su  esposo en los gastos  de la casa  y a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener  una tienda de ropa mas grande  de la horita tiene  ya que quisiera  vender también calzado. 
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Esther is thirty-eight years old and she has been selling clothing for the past seven years together with her husband, Lorenzo. He is forty-two years old.

She is a very hardworking woman who likes to help her husband in whatever possible. When her husband sets out to milk the cows she goes along with him. When she comes back she curdles the milk and she makes cheeses. She requested a loan to purchase more clothing, especially because it sells out quickly. Her clients place orders but she doesn't have sufficient funds to cover the initial expense. 

She has three children: a girl named Francisca Yesenia, 12 years old, and two boys, 9-year old Gilberto and three-year old Daniel.

She is very happy with her business because she earns new clients every day and her business is growing. She loves having her own business because she is able to help her husband with the household expenses and her children are able to stay in school.

One of her dreams is to have a larger clothing store compared to what she has now. She would also like to start selling shoes.

She is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the support that they give to individuals who want to have a business of their own, to get ahead to help their families.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora  Julia  tiene treinta y cinco años  de edad , se  dedica  a la venta de ropas desde hace tres años atrás .
Es una  señora  muy trabajadora  le gusta  mucho  lavar ajeno para tener un dinero extra para  imprevistos.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos  una mujer Estefania   de trece años de edad  y Irvin de  diesi ocho años de edad los dos estudian.
Esta  muy contenta por que su negocio cada día va creciendo mas  , sus hijos la ayudan  en la tienda cuando salen  de la escuela .
Pidió el préstamo  para la compra de mas  ropa ya que  en ocasiones tiene demasiados pedidos y  no le alcanza el dinero para  enviar las tallas para que le puedan mandar su mercancía. 
Uno de  sus sueños es  tener  una tienda de ropa y una farmacia  ya que en ocasiones  va donde su hermana   Fabiola  quien tiene  una farmacia  y vende muy bien  y por donde ella vive no hay una farmacia  cerca y seria un buen negocio.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado , para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños  que tenia para el futuro  y gracias a su apoyo  los esta haciendo  realidad.
texts.en:
Julia is thirty-eight years old and she has been selling clothing for the past three years. She is a very hardworking woman who very much enjoys offering laundry services to have an extra source of income for unforeseen expenses. She has two children: a girl named Estefania who is thirteen years old, and 18-year old Irvin. They both attend school. She is very happy because her business grows more each day and her children help her with the store when they are out of school.

She requested a loan to purchase more clothing because at time she has too many orders placed and she doesn't have the funds to cover the initial expense, which must be done prior to them sending her merchandise.

One of her dreams is to have a clothing store and pharmacy. At times she goes to her sister Fabiola's pharmacy and she sees that it does well, and where she lives there are no other nearby pharmacies and it would be a good business.

She is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the support they have given her, helping her to move forward and to attain her dreams for the future. It is thanks to their support that this is becoming a reality.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel de 33 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María Isabel desde hace 3 años se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte de adelante de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus obligaciones de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.  María Isabel con trabajo y esmero a logrado sacar adelante poco a poco a su familia, algo que le da mucha tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 33 years old and she live with her husband and children in a house that is their own property. It is not equipped with the basic services and it is located in the district of Tambogrande, belonging to the department of Piura. It is a region known for its agricultural, farming, and artisan activities.

Maria Isabel has been selling livestock for 3 years (pigs, sheep, and poultry). She raises them in corrals located in the front section of her property. She feeds them balanced feed, grain, sand natural grasses. Once they are fully grown she sells them to clients or in the different markets of the regions. With the profits that she earns she is able to cover the household responsibilities.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. She will purchase balanced feed. Once the livestock have grown she sells them to her clients and with the earnings she will repay her loan and she will improve the quality of life for her family. Maria Isabel plans to move her family forward through hard work and dedication, a fact that brings her great peace.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino de 48 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Sabino se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, además de ser productos consumido diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo y a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra una vez que se inicie la cosecha de su maíz, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Sabino con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a sus hijos, con la intensión de brindarles otras oportunidades académicas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Sabino is 48 years old and he lives with his family in a house that is his own property. It is not equipped with the basic services and it is located in the rural district of Morrope, belonging to the department of Lambayeque. It is region known for its agriculture, farming, and its artisans. 

Sabino is an agriculturist who has his own cultivation land where to plant corn. It is an activity he has carried out for several years. The products are consumed on a daily basis by the population and once the harvest season arrives he sells the products in the different markets of the region and outside the region. He wants to provide a better quality of life to his wife and children with the help of the profits he earns.

He has observed an increase in his business so he has seed the need to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. It will help him cover the labor expenses incurred once his corn is ready to be harvested. With the earnings he obtains he will be able to repay his loan and he will be able to provide for the daily needs of his family. Sabino wants to provide his children with the best through hard work and dedication. His intention is to give them better academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to cover labor expenses incurred during the harvest season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a copier and add more telephone plans, as well as to invest in candies.

loans.name: Jorge William

texts.es:
Jorge de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y turismo.

Desde hace algunos años Jorge se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, papel higiénico, huevos, atún, etc), su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2200 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería para su tienda y una máquina industrial recta para costura, ya que desea incursionar en otro negocio, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias para su hogar.  Jorge es una persona responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa porque su familia tenga lo que el  no pudo tener, además de brindarle mejores estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and children in his own house which has water and electricity. It is located in the rural area of the district in the department of Lambayeque. This area is characterized by its farming, cattle and tourism.   

For several years, Jorge has sold basic necessity products (milk, rice, oil, toilet paper, eggs, tuna, etc.). His business is in his house for convenience. With the earnings from selling his products, he tries to cover all of his expenses and family needs.   

In order to outfit his business he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of  2200 nuevos soles to buy more merchandise for his store and an industrial sewing machine. He wants to get into another business and this will allow him to make more income for his family. Jorge is a responsible and hardworking person who wants his family to have what he couldn't have. He also wants to give his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make home improvements.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio de 39 años, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con sólo servicios de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Julio desde hace 4 años se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos, cabras, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.  Julio con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, algo que le da mucha tranquilidad y orgullo.
texts.en:
Julio is 39 years old, single, and lives in his own house which has only electrical services. It is located in Tambogrande district, Piura department. The economy of the zone is characterized by agriculture, livestock raising, and artisan crafts.

Since he was 4 years old, Julio has sold corral animals (pigs, goats, sheep, and chickens). He raises them in corrals at the back of his house, on livestock feed, grains and natural grasses. Once they have reached ideal size, Julio sells them to customers, or in the different markets of the zone, and with the income he provides for his family's obligations.

Julio is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 new sols to buy animal feed. Once his animals are  fattened, he will sell them to his customers. With the earnings, Julio will pay off the loan and improve his family's quality of life. Julio, with much work and effort, has been able to advance his family, which gives him much pride and tranquility.

loans.use: buy larger quantities of livestock feed.

loans.name: Ledy Yuli

texts.es:
Ledy tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia con su esposo e hijo, el cual no tiene los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumí que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura, ganadería y artesana.

Ledy desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos y gallinas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales; para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo y poder ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona, para obtener muy buenas ganancias que le ayudarán a solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectiva comida, con la finalidad de obtener un mejor precio con sus clientes, lo que permitirá mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Ledy es una madre trabajadora, empeñosa y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio prospere para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ledy is thirty-one and lives with her husband and children in their own house, which does not have basic utilities.  They live in the rural area of the Mochumí district in the department of Lambayeque.  The primary activities in this region are agriculture, cattle, and handicrafts.  

For a number of years Ledy has earned her living raising and selling poultry (turkeys and chickens).  The pen is behind the house.  She feeds the birds a balanced diet with natural grains for optimal growth.  That way she can sell them at local markets for really good profits that will help pay household expenses.

Ledy has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 soles to buy more poultry and feed so she can get better prices and improve her family's standard of living.  She is a hard-working mother and very responsible; all she wants if for her business to prosper so her family can succeed.

loans.use: to buy more poulty and feed.

loans.name: Maria Isolina

texts.es:
María  de 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace unos 6 años aproximadamente María se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (todo tipo de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos personales.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías y también aves de corral para incursionar en un nuevo negocio, con el único ideal de que su negocio se amplie y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  con el dinero que gane para cubrirá su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  María es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarle más comodidades y tranquilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old, single and lives at home with her parents.  They have water and electricity and are located in a rural area of Mórrope district, which is part of Lambayeque department.  This area is characterized by its agricultural activity, cattle raising and artisans.

Maria has sold groceries (all types of products used daily such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc.) and beverages for approximately six years. She has run the business from her home, for her own security, and tries to cover all her personal expenses with profits from her sales.

She has requested a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to support her business and will buy more merchandise, as well as poultry in order to penetrate a new market with the goal of expanding her business and offering more goods to her customers; with the money earned she will repay her loan and meet her household obligations. Maria is a dedicated and hard-working person who is committed to providing more amenities and economic peace of mind to her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store and to begin to offer poultry for sale, as well.

loans.name: Maria Adelina

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral es amplio; lo tiene en su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos  naturales, una vez que lleguen a su peso  y tamaño ideal lo ofrece a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar sus responsabilidades diarias del hogar. 
 
Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para sus animales, con la finalidad de obtener un buen precio por parte de sus clientes a quien ofrece sus ovejas y así pueda tener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.  María es una persona trabajadora y responsable con el objetivo principal de sacar adelante a su familia y poderle brindar estudios superiores a sus hijos en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
María, age 41, lives with her husband and children in their own house.  The house, located in the Mórrope district in the Lambaqeque department, does not have basic services.  This zone is known for its agriculture, livestock, and arts and crafts.

For several years María has been raising and selling sheep.  She has a large pen at her house.  She feeds the sheep balanced feed and natural fodder.  When they reach the ideal size and weight she offers them for sale to her customers.   With the income that she gets she is able pay for her daily household responsibilities.

She has requested a loan for 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy more animals and feed for the animals.  Her purpose for doing so is to get a good price from her customers who buy her sheep.  That way she will be able to have greater income in order to improve her quality of life.

María is a hard-working and responsible person.  Her main objective is to get her family ahead and to be able to offer her children higher education in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. crianza D. cuyes, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los cuyes y luego los venD. en las diferentes ferias que existe en la ciudad D. Cusco y lo venD. en forma ambulatoria en el mercado, la socia trabaja desD. las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio D. este negocio D. crianza D. cuyes la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. crianza D. cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y también para comprar alimento para los cuyes.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. venta D. pollos, negocio D. transporte, negocio D. venta D. artesanía, negocio D. venta D. maquinaria, negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Kusikoyllor Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Valentina is a member.  She is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  She works in her business of raising guinea pigs.  She fattens them, and the guinea pigs grow.  She then sells them at different fairs in the city of Cusco.  She sells in an itinerant manner at the market.  She works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  It is through this business of raising guinea pigs that Valentina gets her children ahead.

She would like to expand her business of raising guinea pigs.  She is requesting the loan in order to buy guinea pigs and feed for the guinea pigs.

The businesses of the other members are selling chicken, transportation, selling handicrafts, selling machinery, and a grocery store.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for the guinea pigs.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
2.	Luis es un señor de 44 años que vive con su esposa e hijos en un pequeño pueblo en Guanacaste llamado la Garita. La Garita es una planicie de clima bastante cálido donde se desarrollan actividades tales como la ganadería, Agricultura y el Turismo Rural.

Desde hace varios años Luis se dedica al alquiler de maquinaria Fernanda S.A, en el cual los vecinos de su comunidad se muestran muy satisfechos. Dice que inicio su negocio a sus 22 años teniendo su propia maquinaria pesada, que fue una herencia que le dejaron sus padres. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

Actualmente Don Luis está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de repuestos para la maquinaria, para reparar sus maquinarias y asi seguir brindando su servicio a sus clientes, además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto el espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. 

Don Luis es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito, y espera poder seguir participando de manera más activa en este tipo de organizaciones. Y nos afirma que la ECC ha tenido gran impacto en la comunidad, ya que antes no tenían oportunidades para ayudar económicamente a los habitantes.
texts.en:
Luis, age 44, lives with his wife and children in a small community in Guanacaste called La Garita. It is located on a plain with a very warm climate where activities such as cattle-raising, agriculture, and tourism, among others, occur.

For several years Luis has been working by renting Fernanda S.A. machinery.  His neighbors in the community are very satisfied.  He says that he started his business 22 years ago.  He had his own heavy machinery, which was an inheritance that his parents left him.  He also says that the project is very interesting to him because he has seen how, little by little, his business is growing and there is more demand.

Luis is currently requesting a microloan for ¢500.000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy replacement parts for the machinery.  He will repair his machinery, and that way he will continue to offer his customers good service.  This is in addition to expanding and strengthening his place.

With this he hopes to make his business grow more and to improve his quality of life.  His business is going well, but due to his lack of money he has not been able to make it grow more.

Luis is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita, one of the 110 member organizations with EDESA in Costa Rica.

This will be his first loan, and he plans to continue participating more actively in this type of organization.  

He assure us that ECC (Communal Credit Companies in English – are small credit organizations created and run by the very people who borrow from them) has had a great impact on the community because they previously did not have opportunities to financially help the inhabitants.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for machinery to rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bricks, sheets of zinc, cement, window and door frames, sand and tile, then pay laborers to build a kitchen onto her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc and wood, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a laptop computer for her grandchilden's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy liquid soap, disinfectant, shampoo, Suavitel fabric softener and silver plated jewelry sets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, iron, and zinc roofing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy zinc, brick, and cement, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and tiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medicines and medical examinations.

loans.name: Dany

texts.en: Dany, 27 year old, is a tailor. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $9 per day. She has three children. All of the children are studying. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $3 on rent, $8 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fabric to make clothes to sell. Before, she worked in the factory and she knew how to sew very well, but she did not have enough money to start this career. After working in the factory, she saved some money so she quit work and started working as a tailor at home. If her career can get more customers, she will extend it by buy more sewing machines and place them at home. For her children, she will try hard to send them to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Saroueng

texts.en: Saroueng, 35 year old, is working in a factory with her husband. Their income is $6 per day. She has one child who is studying. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $25 on transportation, and $35 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy Khmer skirts to sell in the factory where she is working. In the future, she wants to get a tailoring shop for herself, so that she can take care of her children and property at home. She will work hard to send her children to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy Khmer skirts to sell in the factory

loans.name: Samarn

texts.en: Samarn, 39 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker with $4 per day for her income. She has three children. All of the children are working in the factory with $10 income for all. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to use to travel to work. Her husband wants to buy a small car for doing taxi service in the future instead of working as a construction worker when he gets older.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Sarum, 44 years old, is a farmer. She is a single mother with four children. One of her children is studying and the other three are working in the factory with $2 income per day for each. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy a cow for plowing her field. She earns so little money from her career but she doesn’t know what the career she can do besides farming. Luckily, she gets support from her children who are working every month for her living.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow her field

loans.name: Porn

texts.en: Porn, 40 years old, is a security guard with her husband in a casino. Their income is $8 per day. She has one child who is 12 years old and still studying at school. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $7 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work with her husband. In the future, she wants to sell grocery goods at home when she has enough money. For her daughter, she wants to send her to learn a skill after she finishes high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
This borrower is from Benito Soliven. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. 

Janette has had a food business since 2010, where she sells tomato, cabbage, pineapple, and other products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

She is requesting for a loan of PHP6,000 to purchase additional eggplant, tomato, potato, cabbage and pineappleto sell to their community. The income she will generate will be used to renovate the outside and inside of her store. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family's quality life.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggplant, tomato, potato, cabbage and pineappleto sell in the community

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
37-year-old Marilyn is married and has three young children. Her husband works as an independent construction worker. Marilyn has been a vegetables and fruits vendor for two years in the community. Sales have increased recently because of the good service and prices she offers. She sells 150 PHP a day of fruits and vegetables. 

Currently she needs another loan of PHP 5,000 to buy food items so that she will earn more money and help her husband with household expenses. Through hardship and patience, she does everything to make her family's life better.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes, pineapple and watermelon for her store

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean, 33 years old, is a farmer with her husband. They earn $6 per day income. She has four children. Three of the children are studying. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $7 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,100 to buy a motorbike for traveling to do farming with her husband. In the future, she wants to feed pigs to sell and sell grocery goods to make more income to support her children’s studying, because she wants to send them to the university so that they can get a good job.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel to do farming

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is 36 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan to purchase more items to sell like soy sauce, vinegar, juices, snack foods and bread.

She has been running her store for two years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

She wants to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase juices, snack foods, bread and spices

loans.name: Nedy

texts.en:
Nedy is 37 years old, married, and has seven children. She operates a small retail business selling soap, shampoo, perfumes, and other cosmetics. Nedy has been running this business for two years. She intends to use her loan to purchase more personal use products such as shampoo, soap bars and detergent for sale. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a wholesale one. She also hopes that someday she can renovate her house to have better living conditions. Nedy describes herself as visionary.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, perfume, soap and lotion for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a Tok Tok (a motorbike with a cart attached) for her son to start a new career.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, 29 years old, is selling sweets. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver (a motorbike with a cart attached). Their income is $11 per day. She has two children, 8 and 9 years old; both of them are studying at school. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a new Tok Tok to continue her husband's career because the current Tok Tok is old and needs a lot of fixing. In the future, she wants to get a shop for selling many kinds of cakes, and her husband wants to buy a small car to transport foreigners or tourists to visit any place in his province as this can make a good income for their family.

loans.use: to buy a new Tok Tok (a motorbike with a cart attached) for her husband's career.

loans.name: Sarorng

texts.en:
Sarorng is working as a waitress in a hotel. Her husband is a cook in the hotel in which his wife is working. Their income is $8 per day. She has one child; he is 3 years old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy construction materials to build a house. This loan will help her to get a good house to live in with her husband and child, because before she lived with her parent. In the future, she wants to sell food at her house so that she can stay home and look after her children and also can have a career for herself.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is farmer with an income of $1.60 per day. She is a single mother with one son; he is a goldsmith with $4 of income per day. Every month, she has to spend $35 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy equipment for her son to decorate gold well. She did not want to do anything besides farming but she wants to enlarge her son's career to get a good shop and have enough equipment for his work.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her son to decorate gold.

loans.name: Voun

texts.en: Voun is an electrical mechanic and sometimes he offers a motor taxi service when he can not get any electronics to fix. His income is $6 per day. He is staying with his parent and other three siblings. Every month, he has to support his family with $100 for other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a new motorbike for traveling to fix electronics and for doing his motor taxi service. In the future, he hopes to have enough money to start a small business selling electronic equipment. He wants to help his brothers and sister to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 39 years old and married to a tricycle driver named Allan. Together they are raising their two children to grow up beautifully. To add to her husband's income, Evangeline keeps herself busy preparing and cooking daily meals to sell in her food stall in front of their house. She cooks meat recipes like "adobo" (chicken or pork marinated in garlic, soy sauce and vinegar usually paired with liver and fried or sauteed). She wants to improve her skills in cooking different recipes to offer and increase the capacity of sales from her business. 

Evangeline has had this business for almost 10 years and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy chicken and pork meats and ingredients such as salt, sugar, vinegar and cooking oil used in food preparation to create a good quality taste that will pass the taste standards of her regular customers.

As of now, she is working hard to provide continuous sustenance for the education of her children and will soon expand her venture in the food business to earn consistent profits.

loans.use: to buy chicken and pork meats and ingredients such as salt, sugar, vinegar and cooking oil for food preparation.

loans.name: Salin

texts.en: Salin, 29 years old, teaches weaving. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver. Their income is $10 per day. She has three children. One of the children is studying at school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $8 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,100 to buy a new motorbike to continue her husband's career. The current motorbike is old and needs a lot of fixing. For her children, she wants to send them to study at the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Jun

texts.en: Jun, 45 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a security guard. Their income is $8 per day. She has five children: three are studying, and the other one is working in a guesthouse with $4 per day for her income. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $8 on electricity, $30 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband and her children to travel to work. In the future, she hope to send the rest of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Poly

texts.en: Poly, 30 years old, is a motor taxi driver. His wife is selling second-hand clothes at the market, and their income is $9 per day. Poly has one child; he is 4 years old. Every month, Poly has to spend $60 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees and $20 on transportation. He would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a new motorbike to continue his career because the current motorbike need too much fixing. In the future, he wants to rent a store in the market for his wife to sell new clothes. For his child, he wants to send him to study in the university so that he can get a good job to do in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to continue his career.

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: TH., 33 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver with an income of $6 per day. She has three children. Two of the children are studying. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $3 on electricity, and $8 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a cow to feed and get its baby to sell. She will use the rest of the money for an electrical system to use in her house. This loan can help her family to have electricity to use like the other villagers. In the future, she wants to buy a new Tok Tok for her husband to continue his career, because the current Tok Tok is old and the tourists like the new Tok Tok.

loans.use: To buy a cow and an electrical system for her house

loans.name: Jeam

texts.en: Jeam, 35 years old, is a worker. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $8 per day. She has three children. Two of the children are studying. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work with her husband. Before, she was a farmer but she could get little income so she changed to work as a worker. She also does farming when she has free time from her work to make more income to support her children, as she wants to send them to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en: Sreytouch, 28 years old, is a groceries seller. Her husband is a teacher and their income is $7 per day. She has one child who is two years old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy grocery goods to sell. She has been doing this career for about 10 years already, so she has a lot of customers. That's why she needs to buy more goods to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her career now so that she can sell more kinds of goods to serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Despite life's difficulties, Flordeliza is still aiming to see her family lifted up from their status of living. She wants to give their children a better future someday through their farming business. She is 58 years old and a mother of three children. 

Her husband has been a farmer and raised livestock for almost 39 years. They earn an average income of PHP 40,000 after four months of raising their crops and livestock. They use the income for food, clothing and house improvement.

Flordeliza is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and farm machinery to increase crop yields in farming. She is hoping that they will produce a good harvest each cropping to earn more income for the future sake of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and farm machinery

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gnin

texts.en: Gnin, 71 years old, is a farmer. Her husband helps to plow the villager’s field. Their income is $4 per day. She stays with one daughter who is a garment factory worker with an income of $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, and $30 on other expenses for the family. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy fertilizer for her field. This loan will help her family to be able to buy seed and fertilize to continue doing farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en: Ratha, 25 year old, is weaver. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $6 per day. She has two children. They are six and three years old. Every month she has to spend $35 on food, $15 on transportation, and $40 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a Tok Tok for her husband to provide Tok Tok service that can make more income than his motor taxi service. She plans to repair her house when she has enough money because her house is not in good enough condition to stay in it.

loans.use: To buy a Tok Tok for her husband

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 51 years old and married. He has three children ages 26, 22 and 20.

Reynaldo is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. He tills his own land and grows rice and corn crops. Reynaldo also owns a sari-sari store business that his wife manages.

Reynaldo will use his loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to have his own capital someday and to have savings for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kit

texts.en: Kit, 66 years old, is making noodles to sell. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $2 per day. There is one daughter living with her who works in Phnom Penh as a cook with an income of $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $30 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy a motorbike for her daughter to use to travel to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to operate a local hair and beauty salon.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha is a vegetable seller. Her husband is a worker who transports goods for others. Their income is $6 per day. She has four children. Two of the children are studying and one is working with an income of $2 per day. Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a small car for transporting goods to others who need this service. In the future, she wants to have more cars to transport goods to others to make more income.

loans.use: To buy a small car for transporting goods

loans.name: Sokghet

texts.en: Sokghet, 38 years old, is selling fruit. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $10 per day. She has three children. They are 12, 8 and 4 years old. Every month she has to spend $30 on food, $6 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $50 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to transport fruit to sell. In the future, she wants to extend her store to sell more kinds of fruit to make more income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport fruit to sell

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en: Sreymao, 27 years old, is a weaver. Her husband is a worker. Their income is $9 per day. She has one child who one year old.  Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $6 on electricity, $25 on transportation, and $25 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a cow for feeding to get its baby to sell. Before, she was a farmer but she uses her free time from farming to weave to makes skirts to sell. Now she only weaves at home because she has to take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 36 years old, is a garment factory worker. She is a single mother with two children. They are 13 and 3 years old. Every month she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy materials to open a cafe at home. This loan helps her to have a cafe to earn money by herself. She hopes to run her café well so that she can make more income to help her children to at least finish secondary school.

loans.use: To buy materials to open a cafe shop at home

loans.name: Rim

texts.en: Rim, 32 years old, is a farmer. Her husband works in a company. Their income is $4 per day. She has two children. They are seven and three years old. One of her children is studying. Every month she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 rent, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travel to work. Besides working in the company, her husband also takes time to feed the chickens to sell and it is running well. He could make a good income from selling the chickens. In the future, she wants to feed more chickens to sell so that she will be able to send her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 39 years old, is a vegetable seller. Her husband is a blacksmith. Their income is $7 per day. She has three children. Two of the children are studying at school. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $15 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy materials to expand her husband's career. In the future, she plans to get a bigger shop for her husband so that doing his career will be easier than now. For her children, she expects to send them to study at the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand her husband's blacksmith career

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a married man with three children aged 20, 18 and 12 years old. He has been a farmer for over 10 years. He tills land in Banga, South Cotabato and grows rice and corn crops. Abraham earns about 4,500 PHP per month doing this farming. 

Abraham is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Abraham hopes to earn more profit and to save more.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, 55, is married with eight children and lives in the Philippines. She is raising a pig to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. 

Rosemarie has requested a loan to purchase additional pigs to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed lives and works in Tajikistan. He is an active and hardworking man. He is married and the father of one child. Jamshed rented a car from the brand "Gazelle" and he drives it in the local route. He wants to buy his own Gazelle in order to make a good profit and improve his living conditions. For this purpose, he has requested a loan of $2000 USD. Jamshed hopes that the lenders will support him with this purchase.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a “Gazelle” car.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Sarum, 30, is a farmer. Her husband is a carpenter and their income is $3 per day. She has two children and one is studying. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes for villagers in order to make income. She wants to change her career to be a tailor because she has this skill and it can make good income. It will also allow her to stay home to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to sew villagers clothes.

loans.name: Te

texts.en: Te, 58, is a farmer. With her husband, their income is $2 per day. The couple have two children, one of whom works in a factory for $2 per day. Each month, Te has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on rent, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a cow for feeding with the plan to sell its baby. In the future, she wants to feed chickens and pigs at home because it is an easy career from which she would be able to make a good income.

loans.use: to buy a cow for feeding with the intention to sell its baby.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar, 39, is married with two children, aged 9 and 5. He has been a farmer for almost 10 years. He tills land in Banga, South Cotabato and grows rice and corn crops. Edgar works hard to improve his business and sustain his family.

Edgar has requested a loan to purchase one sack of seeds, two sacks of fertilizers and one quart of herbicide. In the future, Edgar hopes to have his own farming equipment. He also hopes for his children to finish their studies and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of seeds, two sacks of fertilizers and one quart of herbicide.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 39, lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children.

Myrna has a store which sells a variety of goods such as soft drinks, canned goods, etc. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional soft drinks and canned goods.

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Myrna hopes to own a mini grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft drinks and canned goods for her store.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim, 46, is a garment factory worker. Her husband sells rice and their income is $6 per day. She has one child who is 18 and still studying. Each month, she spends $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $10 on housing rent. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fertilize and seeds for farming to grow rice to sell. She wants to send her son to study and finish university.

loans.use: to buy fertilize and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 54, lives in Zamora, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Myrna has a business selling snacks such as puto, bibingca, suman, hotcake, etc. She earns about 3,200 PHP each month doing this type of work. Myrna has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Myrna would like to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Sreyny
